original: lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mgo bo'i 'khor lor rtsa'i kun du spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis bskyed pa ste rtsa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: lhan skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mgo bo'i 'khor lor rtsa'i kun du spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis bskyed pa ste rtsa dgu pa'o //
translated: The “innate” and so forth are the nine channels generated by the nature of the conduct in the head cakra.

original: zhing brgyad kyi rang bzhin ma rnams te dgu pa ni zhing thams cad kyi bdag nyid can aa wa dh'a t'i dum bu bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhing brgyad kyi rang bzhin ma rnams te dgu pa ni zhing thams cad kyi bdag nyid can aa wa dh'a t'i dum bu bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The eight fields are the eight channels, and the ninth is the nature of all fields, the four parts of the avadhūti.

original: de yang padma rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso mo 'di rnams kyi lha rdzas kyi bde ba nyams su myong bas dbu ma'i bdag nyid du byed pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang padma rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso mo 'di rnams kyi lha rdzas kyi bde ba nyams su myong bas dbu ma'i bdag nyid du byed pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, these goddesses of the maṇḍala of the vajra lotus experience the bliss of the divine substance and make it the nature of the central channel, and so forth.🔽Graceful, heroic, terrifying,🔽fierce, laughing, frightening,

original: sgeg dang dpa' dang 'jigs rung dang // drag po dgod pa 'jigs byed dang // snying rje ngo mtshar zhi ba ste //
analyzed: sgeg dang dpa' dang 'jigs rung dang // drag po dgod pa 'jigs byed dang // snying rje ngo mtshar zhi ba ste //
translated: compassionate, amazing, peaceful,

original: gang dgu yi ni ro dang ldan //
analyzed: gang dgu yi ni ro dang ldan //
translated: and the ninth is the taste.

original: zhes so // de bshad pa //
analyzed: zhes so // de bshad pa //
translated: That is explained.

original: de la bkur bar kha ba dang // bla 'jog pa dang rab brkyang dang // sbrang ma dril chung phreng rnams dang // rgyas dang rkang pa mnyam pa dang // rol bskyod la sogs shes bya ste //
analyzed: de la bkur bar kha ba dang // bla 'jog pa dang rab brkyang dang // sbrang ma dril chung phreng rnams dang // rgyas dang rkang pa mnyam pa dang // rol bskyod la sogs shes bya ste //
translated: the dance, and so forth,

original: rtsa rnams mnyam par 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams mnyam par 'ching ba'o //
translated: as the binding of the channels in union.

original: de yi phyi rol phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: de yi phyi rol phyag rgya rnams //
translated: The outer mudras are

original: rgyu yis thams cad byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu yis thams cad byung ba'o //
translated: all the causes.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule.

original: de ltar phyag rgya'i rang bzhin rnams kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams te de rnams kyis phyag rgya'i lan gyi tshul gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i tshul byas na 'dis yongs su dgyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya'i rang bzhin rnams kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams te de rnams kyis phyag rgya'i lan gyi tshul gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i tshul byas na 'dis yongs su dgyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the yoginis of the natures of the mudras, by those in the manner of the reply of the mudras, one should please them by the method of the practice and so forth as explained.

original: de ltar tshul ni slar yang gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshul ni slar yang gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The method is again, “whatever with whatever,” and so on.

original: mdog dang dri la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa de'i me tog la sogs pa'i tshul du bya'o //
analyzed: mdog dang dri la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa de'i me tog la sogs pa'i tshul du bya'o //
translated: One should do it in the manner of their flowers and so forth, indicated by their color, scent, and so on.

original: da ni 'di'i sbyor ba la rab tu 'jug pa lhun gyis grub pas gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe ming gi dang po'i yi ge la sogs pas gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i sbyor ba la rab tu 'jug pa lhun gyis grub pas gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe ming gi dang po'i yi ge la sogs pas gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: Now, when this application is spontaneously engaged, then at that time, it is clearly stated by the first letter of the name, etc.🔽The one called Vasudhārā, etc., and the application is as will be explained by the letters of the name.

original: sa srung ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rab tu sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gi yi ge rnams kyis 'di'i de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa srung ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rab tu sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gi yi ge rnams kyis 'di'i de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it thus.

original: gnas la sogs pa'i dang po'i yi ge dang byang chub kyi phyags kyi rig pa ste /
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa'i dang po'i yi ge dang byang chub kyi phyags kyi rig pa ste /
translated: The first letter of the place, etc., and the awareness of the branches of enlightenment,

original: 'dis bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: are to be accomplished by this, etc. It is explained in that way.

original: de ltar 'di'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa ;
translated: Thus, its application is stated.

original: ae'i yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ae'i yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The letter e, etc.

original: ae'i yi ge'i don gyis te ye shes kyi rlung rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rang gi rig pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa la srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi dbus su rab tu 'jug pa ste /🔽'chad par 'gyur ba'i rab tu sbyor bas rang bzhin gyis @225a * //
analyzed: ae'i yi ge'i don gyis te ye shes kyi rlung rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rang gi rig pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa la srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams kyi dbus su rab tu 'jug pa ste / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rab tu sbyor bas rang bzhin gyis @225a * //
translated: By the meaning of the letter e, “the vital winds of pristine consciousness” means that the vital winds such as life enter into the middle of the aspects of bliss of one’s awareness of diversity.🔽By the yoga to be explained, the nature of the mind and so forth

original: sems la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: are purified.

original: de ltar de rnams slar yang rlung rnams zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba ni 'pho pa med ba gyen du 'bang ba'i dus su 'og dang steng du ae'i rnam pa gnyis 'dus pa yi ge ste /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams slar yang rlung rnams zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba ni 'pho pa med ba gyen du 'bang ba'i dus su 'og dang steng du ae'i rnam pa gnyis 'dus pa yi ge ste /
translated: Thus, “again, the vital winds in the moon mandala” means that the two forms of e below and above unite at the time of the upward movement of the nontransmigrating [wind].

original: ae'i yi ge'i 'du shes su des dbu mar zhugs pas so //
analyzed: ae'i yi ge'i 'du shes su des dbu mar zhugs pas so //
translated: The letter is the perception of the letter e, since it enters the central channel by that.

original: de la 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
translated: There, “passion” and so forth explain the meaning of the letter ra.

original: 'dod chags me ni byang chub kyi sems dang srog rnams rab tu 'bar bas thams cad de la de ltar thim pa nyid du 'gro ba ste der ni gang zhig der rang bzhin bsam du med pa'i gzugs de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa rnams rnal 'byor ma'i thugs🔽kyi 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags me ni byang chub kyi sems dang srog rnams rab tu 'bar bas thams cad de la de ltar thim pa nyid du 'gro ba ste der ni gang zhig der rang bzhin bsam du med pa'i gzugs de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa rnams rnal 'byor ma'i thugs kyi 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the form of the nature of that, which is inconceivable, becomes the aspect of the nature of the yoginī’s mind.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo yang khams thams cad kyi nang du aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo yang khams thams cad kyi nang du aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: The mind-wheel is like the nature of the avadhūti within all the constituents.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di'i de ltar rab tu sbyor ba pa'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di'i de ltar rab tu sbyor ba pa'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the syllables of this application is stated by vajra, etc.🔽The “channel that arises from the vajra secret” is the channel through which the bodhicitta falls, abiding within the vajra hole.

original: rdo rje'i gsang ba las langs pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i rtsa rdo rje'i bu ga'i nang du gnas pas las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang snyoms par zhugs pas de rnams kyi rgyun mi 'chad par bskul
analyzed: rdo rje'i gsang ba las langs pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i rtsa rdo rje'i bu ga'i nang du gnas pas las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang snyoms par zhugs pas de rnams kyi rgyun mi 'chad par bskul
translated: By engaging in union with the yoginīs, such as the karma consort, etc., their stream is uninterrupted.

original: zhing gsol ba btab pas de kho na nyid kyis langs pa ste rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyag rnams kyis kyang g-yo zhing 'bab pa rnams par bzung bas rnam par bzung ba 'pho ba med pa'i khams thams cad ye shes khams can mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: zhing gsol ba btab pas de kho na nyid kyis langs pa ste rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyag rnams kyis kyang g-yo zhing 'bab pa rnams par bzung bas rnam par bzung ba 'pho ba med pa'i khams thams cad ye shes khams can mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
translated: having taken hold of the moving and falling, take hold of the entire realm of non-moving, which becomes the realm of wisdom.

original: to // de ltar 'di'i t'i'i yi ges nus mthu byed pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: to // de ltar 'di'i t'i'i yi ges nus mthu byed pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the special power of this ta is stated.

original: 'das dang ma byon sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: 'das dang ma byon sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: The buddhas of the past and future

original: zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin rnams kyi cha shas 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor ba'i cha shas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin rnams kyi cha shas 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor ba'i cha shas so //
translated: are the parts of the various natures of one's mind, the parts of the application of the non-moving.🔽The part of sentient beings is fire,

original: sems can gyi cha can me zhes bya ba ni 'dir sems pa dang rdul dang mun pa'i cha shas rnams kyi dbus su gtso bo'i cha shas rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gyi cha can me zhes bya ba ni 'dir sems pa dang rdul dang mun pa'i cha shas rnams kyi dbus su gtso bo'i cha shas rnams te /
translated: which is the parts of the principal in the middle of the parts of mind, passion, and darkness.

original: snying stobs can gyi cha shas ni bcu drug pa bzhin zad pa med cing 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: snying stobs can gyi cha shas ni bcu drug pa bzhin zad pa med cing 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The part of sattva is considered to be the sixteen, called “the pristine wisdom of non-exhaustion and non-transmigration.”

original: de'i khyad par du byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i khyad par du byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The special feature of that is stated:

original: re re'i zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sems re re'i cha shas dang slar yang sum cu rtsa drug gi khams kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re re'i zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sems re re'i cha shas dang slar yang sum cu rtsa drug gi khams kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Each” is the part of each of the minds of the nature of the three natures, and again, it becomes the nature of the thirty-six constituents.

original: de'i tshad kyis rnal 'byor gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshad kyis rnal 'byor gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: The special feature of yoga is the measure of that, the intended meaning.

original: 'di'i de ltar yang @225b rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi cha shas kyi rnam par gzhag pa k'a ma r'u pa'i yi ge'i ming gis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i de ltar yang @225b rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi cha shas kyi rnam par gzhag pa k'a ma r'u pa'i yi ge'i ming gis gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the arrangement of the parts with that kind of aspect is stated by the name of the letter of the kāmarūpa alphabet:

original: lus can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The bodies” and so on.

original: ka'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: ka'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the letter ka.

original: de ltar lus can gyi gzugs des de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar lus can gyi gzugs des de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, by that form of the bodies, “like that” is

original: 'pho ba med pa der bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa der bskyed pa'o //
translated: generated in that non-transmigration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the Buddha's body is grasped as a thing.

original: / gang du 'dzin par gsungs pa //
analyzed: / gang du 'dzin par gsungs pa //
translated: Where is it grasped?🔽In the field, by the forms beginning with ka, etc.

original: zhing du ka sogs pa gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni k'a ma r'u pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste 'on kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa'i rgyur gyur pas sna tshogs pa'i sku'i gzugs rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i
analyzed: zhing du ka sogs pa gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni k'a ma r'u pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste 'on kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa'i rgyur gyur pas sna tshogs pa'i sku'i gzugs rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i
translated: The phrase kāmarūpa is merely an illustration, but it is also the cause of the needs of all sentient beings in the desire realm, so by the various forms of the body,

original: sku'i gzugs rnams kyis skye ba len par byed do //
analyzed: sku'i gzugs rnams kyis skye ba len par byed do //
translated: he takes birth in various forms of the body.

original: der de ltar chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma'i yi ge'i don to de bzhin du bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: der de ltar chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma'i yi ge'i don to de bzhin du bshad pa byed do //
translated: There, in that way, the meaning of the letter ma is explained by the word great, etc.

original: 'dir gal te de srid sangs rgyas rnams sngags kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid kyis rol pa de'i tshe sna tshogs pa'i phag la sogs pa skye ba len par byed pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'dir gal te de srid sangs rgyas rnams sngags kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid kyis rol pa de'i tshe sna tshogs pa'i phag la sogs pa skye ba len par byed pa ji ltar yin /
translated: Here, if the Buddhas play by the nature of the mantra method at that time, how do they take birth in various forms such as a pig, etc.?

original: 'o na khams drug gi bdag nyid 'di skyes bu chen po'i gang zag yin pa de'i tshe mi'i lus su skye ba len par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na khams drug gi bdag nyid 'di skyes bu chen po'i gang zag yin pa de'i tshe mi'i lus su skye ba len par byed ce na /
translated: Well then, when this person who is a great being, whose nature is the six elements, takes birth in a human body, what is the cause of that?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi the tshom la bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig gis sel bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi the tshom la bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig gis sel bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān states that the words of others are removed by doubt.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Form” and so on.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par don de yis sangs rgyas can zhes bya ba'i ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par don de yis sangs rgyas can zhes bya ba'i ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so ;
translated: By that meaning in the form of form, the buddhas, that is, the bodhisattvas,

original: / kyang gi yi ges sangs rgyas rnams kyang de rnams kyi ste rigs kun zhes bya ba ni phag la sogs par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / kyang gi yi ges sangs rgyas rnams kyang de rnams kyi ste rigs kun zhes bya ba ni phag la sogs par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: also. The syllable “also” means that the buddhas are also of their lineage. One should not understand “all lineages” to be pigs and so on.

original: de'i ltar sems mngon shes drug rnams kyis byang chub kyi gsungs yin de'i tshe de'i rigs rnams kyis 'dul ba nyid pas de'i gzugs phag mo la sogs pa ste de'i tshe der de ltar lus rnams kyis pha rol par 'jig rten du rab tu grags so //
analyzed: de'i ltar sems mngon shes drug rnams kyis byang chub kyi gsungs yin de'i tshe de'i rigs rnams kyis 'dul ba nyid pas de'i gzugs phag mo la sogs pa ste de'i tshe der de ltar lus rnams kyis pha rol par 'jig rten du rab tu grags so //
translated: Thus, when the mind is the six higher perceptions, it is the speech of enlightenment. At that time, since they are disciplined by their lineage, their form is pigs and so on. At that time, in that way, their bodies are well known in the world as the other side.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med mi shes pa ste ji srid sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med mi shes pa ste ji srid sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, form and formlessness are not known, i.e., as long as there is Buddhahood.

original: 'on kyang brtse ba'i 'dod pa nyid chung ma la nges kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang brtse ba'i 'dod pa nyid chung ma la nges kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
translated: But the desire for compassion is small, even in a wife, by the power of a vow.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa pa'i yi ge'i don gyis te bzhin gyi gzugs su byed pa ni phag la sogs pas lha mo gang gi tshe stong pa nyid kyi bag nyid can bcom ldan 'das snying rje dang dbyer med pa nyid du bskyed pa ste
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa pa'i yi ge'i don gyis te bzhin gyi gzugs su byed pa ni phag la sogs pas lha mo gang gi tshe stong pa nyid kyi bag nyid can bcom ldan 'das snying rje dang dbyer med pa nyid du bskyed pa ste
translated: The meaning of the words of the verse beginning with “the other” is this: The one who makes the form of the face of the goddess, i.e., the one who makes the face of the goddess, is a pig, etc. When the Blessed One, who is the nature of emptiness, is generated as inseparable from compassion,

original: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i cho shes par byed pa po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi lam du de'i tshe yang de de ltar @226a * //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i cho shes par byed pa po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi lam du de'i tshe yang de de ltar @226a * //
translated: then the one who makes the face of the goddess is a pig, etc. At that time, the path of the Buddhas of the Bodhisattvas who make the face of the goddess is explained in that way.

original: bshad de / 'di'i don du slar yang shes rab kyi dbang po'i sgo nas dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: bshad de / 'di'i don du slar yang shes rab kyi dbang po'i sgo nas dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: For this purpose, again, by way of the faculty of wisdom and by way of the nature of the factors of enlightenment, it is clearly taught.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The one who is called the “sense faculty” and so forth.

original: kun du 'gro ba sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sbra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa ste 'dod ba lnga la sogs pas gang nye bar mtshon pa'i yul gyi yon tan la sogs pa'i dngos po des de
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sbra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa ste 'dod ba lnga la sogs pas gang nye bar mtshon pa'i yul gyi yon tan la sogs pa'i dngos po des de
translated: The “omnipresent Buddha” is the eye and so forth, form and sound, smell, taste, touch, and so forth, the things that are the qualities of the objects that are characterized by the five objects of desire and so forth.

original: ltar snying rjes brlan pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: ltar snying rjes brlan pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: Thus, the Buddhas are those who are moistened by compassion and so forth.

original: de'i phyir slar yang stong pa nyid gcig tu nges pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir slar yang stong pa nyid gcig tu nges pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, again, it is the perfection of wisdom, because of the certainty of emptiness alone.

original: de ni de la de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de la de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained in that way there.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar sdud pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar sdud pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The concluding verse begins with “thus” and so forth.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste sems can thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ste sems can thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: At that time, one becomes like the form of the yoginī, and all sentient beings also.

original: de ltar snang ba des kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba des kyang ngo //
translated: And by that appearance, also.

original: 'on kyang gtso bor rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud nyid pas rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bor rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud nyid pas rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams te /
translated: However, since the Vajrayoginī Tantra is primary, the forms of the yoginīs

original: de bzhin du ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rnams su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: are the forms of the buddhas. This is the intended meaning.

original: de bzhin du yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ye shes kyi 'khor lor rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams yongs su gzhag pa ste 'di ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ye shes kyi 'khor lor rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams yongs su gzhag pa ste 'di ni nges pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the arrangement of the meditation on the wheel of the maṇḍala, which will be explained, is the arrangement of the forms of the yoginīs in the wheel of gnosis. This is certain.

original: da ni de'i rnam par gzhag pa ye shes kyi 'khor lor dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa yang gsungs pa ye shes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i rnam par gzhag pa ye shes kyi 'khor lor dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa yang gsungs pa ye shes pa ste /
translated: Now, the meditation on the wheel of the maṇḍala in the wheel of gnosis, which is its arrangement, is also stated:

original: 'dod pa thams cad ster zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kun du spyod pa'i khyad par las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi 'dod pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ster zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kun du spyod pa'i khyad par las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi 'dod pa ster ba'o //
translated: The bestowal of all desires is the bestowal of the desire of the spiritual power of the great seal through the special conduct explained previously.

original: bdag po'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor bsgom pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge las byung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdag po'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor bsgom pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge las byung ba gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the lord is said to be the seed syllables that arise from the seed syllables of the mandala circle of those [goddesses].

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mandala and so forth are said to be the seed syllables of the mandala circle of those [goddesses].

original: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas dgos pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas dgos pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, the purposes are as explained previously.

original: lhag ma thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las sa srung ma'i rang bzhin kyi  phyag rgya bzhir skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs dang gnas lugs la sogs pa yongs su brtags pas brda'i phyag rgya dang lan gyi phyag
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las sa srung ma'i rang bzhin kyi  phyag rgya bzhir skyes pa rnams kyi gzugs dang gnas lugs la sogs pa yongs su brtags pas brda'i phyag rgya dang lan gyi phyag
translated: In the commentary on the Ocean of Dakas Great Yoga Tantra, the Ship, the examination of the forms, natures, and so forth of those born as the four seals of the nature of Vasudhara, the symbolic seals and the reply seals are explained.

original: rgya rnams te de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos gang dang rang gi ming gi yi ge dang po dang @226b ldan pa rnams kyi ye shes sgrub pa'i de ltar rab tu sbyor ba'i cho ga dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su rol
analyzed: rgya rnams te de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos gang dang rang gi ming gi yi ge dang po dang @226b ldan pa rnams kyi ye shes sgrub pa'i de ltar rab tu sbyor ba'i cho ga dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su rol
translated: The knowledge of those, i.e., the dharmas of their own characteristics, endowed with the first letter of their own names, is the means of accomplishing knowledge.

original: ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa rgyas par bstan pa ste le'u sum cu rtsa bzhi ba'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa rgyas par bstan pa ste le'u sum cu rtsa bzhi ba'i bshad pa'o /
translated: The extensive teaching of the yoga of the maṇḍala wheel of the characteristics of the enjoyment of the Buddha and so forth in the desire realm is the explanation of the thirty-fourth chapter.

original: // /'jigs byed ma la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: // /'jigs byed ma la phyag byas nas //
translated: Having paid homage to Vajrayoginī,

original: ming chen lhag pa'i rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: ming chen lhag pa'i rnal 'byor ma //
translated: the great name of the yoginī,

original: thams cad bden pa'i brda rnams ni //
analyzed: thams cad bden pa'i brda rnams ni //
translated: all the symbols of truth

original: yi ge yis ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: yi ge yis ni rab tu gnas //
translated: are well-established by syllables.

original: gtum mo'i gzugs can lha mo ni //
analyzed: gtum mo'i gzugs can lha mo ni //
translated: The goddess having the form of Caṇḍālī,

original: phyag rgya yongs su rig byed pa'i //
analyzed: phyag rgya yongs su rig byed pa'i //
translated: the one who fully understands the mudrā,

original: sngon gyi rnal 'byor ma'i gnang bas //
analyzed: sngon gyi rnal 'byor ma'i gnang bas //
translated: the permission of the previous yoginīs,

original: 'grel ba de bzhin yang bshad bya //
analyzed: 'grel ba de bzhin yang bshad bya //
translated: the commentary will be explained accordingly.

original: da ni le'u sum cu rtsa lnga ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: da ni le'u sum cu rtsa lnga ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa ;
translated: Now, the explanation of the thirty-fifth chapter is stated:

original: de nas lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: de nas lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: Then, the goddess, etc.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin rang gis 'jigs byed chen mo'i gzugs kyis phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i bdag nyid kyis mchod pa 'di byas nas dri ba de gsungs pa nyid kyi gsungs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste khyod kyis gsungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin rang gis 'jigs byed chen mo'i gzugs kyis phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i bdag nyid kyis mchod pa 'di byas nas dri ba de gsungs pa nyid kyi gsungs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste khyod kyis gsungs shig pa'o //
translated: Having made this offering, which is of the nature of Vajravarahi, with her own form of Mahabhairava, externally, internally, and secretly, she said, “Speak!”🔽The dakinis, etc.

original: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis te de'i de ltar rigs pas thams cad bden pa lhan cig skyes pa'i brda zhes bya ba bdag gis mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis te de'i de ltar rigs pas thams cad bden pa lhan cig skyes pa'i brda zhes bya ba bdag gis mi shes pa ste /
translated: In this way, by reasoning, I do not understand the reality of the innate gesture, which is called “all things are true.”🔽By whom, etc.

original: gang gis lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya yis 'byung po thams cad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni khams dang phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kun du skrag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya yis 'byung po thams cad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni khams dang phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kun du skrag pa ste /
translated: All beings, etc.

original: bcom par gyur nas de las 'byung ba mthong bas 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa las sgrol bas na de'i phyag rgya'i brda bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bdag nyid du gsungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom par gyur nas de las 'byung ba mthong bas 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa las sgrol bas na de'i phyag rgya'i brda bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bdag nyid du gsungs shig pa'o //
translated: Having been destroyed, since he sees the emergence from that, he is liberated from the afflictions of cyclic existence. Therefore, the Blessed One should explain the mudrā of that nature.

original: de ltar 'di'i lan gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i lan gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, for the sake of answering this, the Blessed One said:

original: nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Listen, etc.

original: snying po'i rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i nang du lhan cig skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog tu zag pa med pa nyid pas snying po'o //
analyzed: snying po'i rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i nang du lhan cig skyes pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog tu zag pa med pa nyid pas snying po'o //
translated: The ocean of the essence is the supreme innate maṇḍala in the center, since it is just non-falling away.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rten nyid pas rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rten nyid pas rgya mtsho'o //
translated: It is an ocean, since it is the very basis of all buddhas.

original: de'i de ltar nang du phyag rgya thams cad gang sngar bshad pa rnams dang phyis lhag par rtogs pa de yang dag par blang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i de ltar nang du phyag rgya thams cad gang sngar bshad pa rnams dang phyis lhag par rtogs pa de yang dag par blang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, all the mudrās that were previously explained and that are later realized should be taken up. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar rgyud gang du yang ma bshad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar rgyud gang du yang ma bshad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, it is not explained in any tantra.

original: dpal 'dus pa la sogs par ro //
analyzed: dpal 'dus pa la sogs par ro //
translated: In the Śrī Guhyasamāja, etc.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi don du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa thams cad zab mo 'di 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs byed chen mo'i ming gis so //🔽da ni phyag @227a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi don du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa thams cad zab mo 'di 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs byed chen mo'i ming gis so // da ni phyag @227a * //
translated: Therefore, “for your sake” is by the name of the Great Fear, which is the explanation of this profound [reality] when all conceptual thoughts are eliminated.

original: rgya rnams kyi rab tu sbyor bas bsgrub par bya ba'i cho ga rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i de bzhin du gsungs pa /🔽rdo rje me yi rab sbyor bas //
analyzed: rgya rnams kyi rab tu sbyor bas bsgrub par bya ba'i cho ga rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i de bzhin du gsungs pa / rdo rje me yi rab sbyor bas //
translated: Now, the innate reality of the ritual for accomplishing the mudras is stated as follows:🔽“The application of the vajra fire”

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i me ste rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i me ste rdo rje ma'o //
translated: is the vajra fire, that is, Vajrā.

original: longs spyod kyi rlabs gnyis btsir ba las langs pa 'di ni 'dod chags kyi me'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rlabs gnyis btsir ba las langs pa 'di ni 'dod chags kyi me'o //
translated: The two waves of enjoyment are squeezed, and this is the fire of passion.

original: de'i phyir nye ba spyod par 'gyur bas rab tu sbyor ba 'dis g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dus su ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs pa'i dbu mar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba spyod par 'gyur bas rab tu sbyor ba 'dis g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dus su ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs pa'i dbu mar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, by the application of the enjoyment, the left and right times enter the central nāḍī, which is the entry into the maṇḍala of gnosis.

original: de'i tshe phyag rgya thams cad de'i nang du rab tu brjod pa ste gsal bar rab tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyag rgya thams cad de'i nang du rab tu brjod pa ste gsal bar rab tu bshad pa'o //
translated: At that time, all mudras are explained to be within that, that is, they are clearly explained.

original: de ltar 'di'i sbyor ba thog mar ci byas nas gnas she na /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i sbyor ba thog mar ci byas nas gnas she na /
translated: Thus, what is done first in this application, and how does one abide?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / lte ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / lte ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The navel,” etc.

original: lte ba'i 'khor lor lha mo gang //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lor lha mo gang //
translated: “The goddess in the navel cakra”

original: zhes bya ba ni aom gyi yi ge'i rnam pa'i gzugs de bsgoms pas /🔽shing mtha' la reg spyod yul lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni aom gyi yi ge'i rnam pa'i gzugs de bsgoms pas / shing mtha' la reg spyod yul lo //
translated: is the form of the letter OṂ, and by meditating on that,🔽“the tree reaches the end of the field.”

original: zhes bya ba ste srog shing rnams la reg pa ste gang du ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste srog shing rnams la reg pa ste gang du ni /
translated: The tree reaches the end of the field, where

original: de'i nang du spyod yul te n'a da'i rang bzhin de'i nang du ste /
analyzed: de'i nang du spyod yul te n'a da'i rang bzhin de'i nang du ste /
translated: “within it” is the nature of the nāḍī.

original: slar yang lhan cig skyes pa'i byang chub byas nas 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgya spyod pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang lhan cig skyes pa'i byang chub byas nas 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgya spyod pa'o //
translated: Again, having made the connate enlightenment, here is the practice of the yoginī’s consort.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having explained this in brief, the extensive explanation is stated:

original: 'gro dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Going and coming,” etc.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa rnams te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rtsa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa rnams te /
translated: The “various nāḍīs” are, in brief, the nāḍīs of the four cakras.

original: rgya che bar ni du ma'o //
analyzed: rgya che bar ni du ma'o //
translated: They are “many” in the extensive [explanation].

original: de rnams kyi nang du yang shes kyi rnam pa'i yi ge'i gzugs su srog gi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams kyi rjes su rim par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du yang shes kyi rnam pa'i yi ge'i gzugs su srog gi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams kyi rjes su rim par byed do //
translated: In the midst of those, the forms of the letters in the aspect of consciousness, following the going and coming of the life-force, are arranged in order.

original: de dang rab tu phrad pas kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dang rab tu phrad pas kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: By encountering that, one holds the form of the innate seal.

original: 'di'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The application of that is stated:

original: thig le zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thig le zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bindu, and so on.

original: de ltar thig le zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i rtsa thams cad kyis rab tu byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis thig le rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar thig le zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i rtsa thams cad kyis rab tu byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyis thig le rnams te /
translated: Thus, the “bindus” are the bindus of the bodhicitta that arises from all the naturally present nāḍīs.

original: de rnams su nyi ma nye bar son pa zhes bya ba na srog gi nyi ma ste 'dod chags chen po'i bdag nyid can du rnam par thim nas song ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams su nyi ma nye bar son pa zhes bya ba na srog gi nyi ma ste 'dod chags chen po'i bdag nyid can du rnam par thim nas song ba'o //
translated: “The sun arrives there” means that the sun of the life-force dissolves into the great passion.

original: de'i tshe phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi sems dang bsam pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid a'a li k'a li'i sbyor bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi sems dang bsam pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid a'a li k'a li'i sbyor bar 'gro'o //
translated: “At that time, the seal” is the intrinsic characteristics of the mind and thoughts of that nature that enter into the union of ālikāli.

original: a'a li k'a li de ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li de ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sum cu rtsa drug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽de ltar thung ngu dang ring po ni dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / de ltar thung ngu dang ring po ni dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams te /
translated: The thirty-six, etc.

original: rtsa so so rnams sam ming gi dang po'i yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: rtsa so so rnams sam ming gi dang po'i yi ge rnams te /
translated: Thus, the short and long vowels and consonants are the individual channels or the first letters of the names.

original: de @227b ltar 'dir mi bden par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de @227b ltar 'dir mi bden par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to make them unreal here,

original: de gnyis kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan ni brda'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan ni brda'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: the mudrā and the reply mudrā of those two are the symbolic letters.

original: shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig ste rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu rgyas par bshad pa'i tshig ste rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The words of the extensive explanation beginning with “wisdom and method,” etc., are easy to understand.

original: da ni 'di'i sbyor ba'i sngon du bshad pa'i 'jigs byed chen po'i ming gi dang bo'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gi ngang gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i sbyor ba'i sngon du bshad pa'i 'jigs byed chen po'i ming gi dang bo'i yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gi ngang gsungs pa /
translated: Now, here, the etymology of the first letter of the name of the great Bhairava is stated before the practice:

original: 'jigs byed chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great Bhairava, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni phyi mo'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni phyi mo'i yi ge ste /
translated: The one to be accomplished is the last letter,

original: phyag rgya'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: in the nature of the mudrā.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: phyi mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ma'i yi ge'i thog ma don gyi nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs rgyu ba ni thams cad aa wa dh'u t'ir 'bab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ma'i yi ge'i thog ma don gyi nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs rgyu ba ni thams cad aa wa dh'u t'ir 'bab par bya'o //
translated: All the movements of the breath should fall into the avadhūtī.

original: de dag thams cad rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin du byas nas des gang dang gang gi ngag 'byung ba ste sems can thams cad kyi yang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya sngags kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin du byas nas des gang dang gang gi ngag 'byung ba ste sems can thams cad kyi yang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya sngags kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having made all of them the nature of one's own awareness, whatever speech arises from that, the form of the innate mudra mantra of all sentient beings, is the meaning.

original: de ltar 'di'i slar yang h'a h'a rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ha'i yi ge'i don gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i slar yang h'a h'a rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ha'i yi ge'i don gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, again here, by the ha ha's, and so on, the meaning of the letter ha is clearly stated.

original: shing gi rtsa bar zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i rtsa bar srog 'char ba na ste gtong ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: shing gi rtsa bar zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i rtsa bar srog 'char ba na ste gtong ba'i dus su'o //
translated: The root of the tree is the root of the navel. When the life force arises, it is the time of emission.

original: der ha ha'i rnam par thams cad nas skad cig tu dngos po mthong ba la sogs pa nas brgad par bya'o //
analyzed: der ha ha'i rnam par thams cad nas skad cig tu dngos po mthong ba la sogs pa nas brgad par bya'o //
translated: There, in the form of ha ha, all things are seen in an instant, and so on. One should laugh.

original: de rnams kyi yang srog la sogs pa thams cad dang yi ge rnam par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang srog la sogs pa thams cad dang yi ge rnam par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And their life-force, etc. , and all the syllables are grasped.

original: de bzhin du bde mchog tu bshad pa'i tshig ha h'a he hee ho hoo ham ha: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad kyis brgad  par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde mchog tu bshad pa'i tshig ha h'a he hee ho hoo ham ha: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad kyis brgad  par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the Cakrasaṃvara, the words ha ha he he ai o au ham kṣa are explained as “one should laugh with the eight aspects.”

original: de nyid kyis 'di ltar dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mdor na bho'i yi ge dang re'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'di ltar dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste mdor na bho'i yi ge dang re'i yi ge'i don gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, he says, “joy,” etc. , and in brief, he explains the meaning of the syllables bho and re.

original: gang mo rnams brgyad kyis shin tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gang mo rnams brgyad kyis shin tu dga' ba ste /
translated: “The eight ladies” are the eight petals.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyis dgyes pa'o //🔽der zhes bya ba ni shing rnams kyi rtsa bar 'du ba de la de skad bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyis dgyes pa'o // der zhes bya ba ni shing rnams kyi rtsa bar 'du ba de la de skad bshad do //
translated: “Joy” is delight by the method of great passion.🔽“There” means at the gathering at the base of the trees.

original: de yang bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bag chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “That” refers to the eight ladies.

original: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: “Habit” is explained by the syllable va.

original: bag chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyir 'gyur ro //
translated: The term free from latent tendencies refers to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth.

original: der de ltar /
analyzed: der de ltar /
translated: Thus,

original: 'jigs byed chen mos zos gyur pa //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen mos zos gyur pa //
translated: she is devoured by the Great Fearful One.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This refers to

original: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i @228a * //🔽dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i @228a * // dbye ba ste /
translated: the divisions of Vajravārāhī and so forth.

original: de yang de nyid kyi le'ur bshad pa'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de yang de nyid kyi le'ur bshad pa'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: Moreover, this is by the meaning of the syllables in the chapter of that [tantra].

original: gcig tu na bag chags za ba ma yin te brtan pa la sogs pa de'i nang du gyur pa na rnam par rtog pa tsam yang za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu na bag chags za ba ma yin te brtan pa la sogs pa de'i nang du gyur pa na rnam par rtog pa tsam yang za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In one way, she does not eat latent tendencies, but when they are transformed into her, she eats even mere conceptuality.

original: de'i phyir lhag par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the special activity is stated:

original: ao da'i gnas dang dad pa'i stobs //
analyzed: ao da'i gnas dang dad pa'i stobs //
translated: the abode of Oḍi and the power of faith.

original: zhes bya ba ste yi ge 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig grangs ji lta ba rnams su spyod yul te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste yi ge 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig grangs ji lta ba rnams su spyod yul te /
translated: These syllables are the domain of conduct according to the enumeration of the etymologies.

original: gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe bya'o zhe na /
translated: When they are transformed, then what?

original: gsungs pa / nya bar gzhal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / nya bar gzhal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, the measure of the middle, and so forth.

original: ao'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: ao'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the syllable O.

original: de ltar nye bar gzhal ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor gyi skad kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar gzhal ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor gyi skad kyi yi ge'o //
translated: Thus, approached is a term of the connecting language.

original: 'di'i don ni padma'i sgras padma ste de ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni padma'i sgras padma ste de ci zhe na /
translated: The meaning of this is: the word padma is a lotus. What is that?

original: rtsa ba'i padma ste ao zhes bya ba ni de nyid aodyana gyi bu ga'i rtsa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i padma ste ao zhes bya ba ni de nyid aodyana gyi bu ga'i rtsa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The root lotus. O is its nature as the channel of the Oddiyana hole.

original: de nyid aodyana de'i khyim gyi dbus su thig le gsum po rnam par thim nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nyid aodyana de'i khyim gyi dbus su thig le gsum po rnam par thim nas 'gro'o //
translated: That very [lotus] dissolves the three drops in the middle of its house and goes.

original: de yang brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa ste 'dir brtan pa dang 'gro ba'i sgras gang cung zad lus kyi khams ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa ste 'dir brtan pa dang 'gro ba'i sgras gang cung zad lus kyi khams ni brtan pa'o //
translated: That is also the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected. Here, the words stable and moving refer to whatever is the stable element of the body.

original: de bzhin du gang cung zad ngag gi brjod pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po de'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang cung zad ngag gi brjod pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po de'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, whatever is the expression of speech, and the entity of mind and mental factors, that is called moving.

original: de yang thim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas d'a'i yi ge'i don gyis rnam par thim nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de yang thim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas d'a'i yi ge'i don gyis rnam par thim nas 'gro'o //
translated: That also dissolves, and so on, with the meaning of the syllable da, it dissolves and goes.

original: dngos po kun gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ste'ang gi sgras kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'ang 'gro'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ste'ang gi sgras kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'ang 'gro'o //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of the universal ground consciousness.

original: de'i tshe mkhas pas phyag rgya rnams kyi ao da na zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa drug gi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan thung ngu dang ring po'i yi ge'i rang bzhin 'di'i rigs pas ao da na lta bur 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mkhas pas phyag rgya rnams kyi ao da na zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa drug gi phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan thung ngu dang ring po'i yi ge'i rang bzhin 'di'i rigs pas ao da na lta bur 'gro'o //
translated: At that time, the wise one should go to Oddiyana of the mudras. Oddiyana is the nature of the short and long syllables of the thirty-six mudras and the replies of the mudras.

original: de'i phyir yang yi ge mdor bsdus pa'i ste ao di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang yi ge mdor bsdus pa'i ste ao di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is also stated clearly by the words Oddiyana and so forth in the summary of the syllables.

original: ao di ya ni nam mkhar ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de'i dus rnams su rnam par thim pa nyid du 'gro ba ste chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: ao di ya ni nam mkhar ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de'i dus rnams su rnam par thim pa nyid du 'gro ba ste chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Oddiyana is space. When at those times, it goes to the state of dissolution, it is the nature of the nature of all phenomena.

original: de'i dbus su //
analyzed: de'i dbus su //
translated: In its center,

original: ye shes 'gro kun nang du'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'gro kun nang du'o //
translated: wisdom goes to all inner places.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo'i chos rnams su 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo'i chos rnams su 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa ste /
translated: The great elements abide in the subtle particles of phenomena.

original: de rnams kyis nam mkha'i phyogs su lus las shar ba na thim pa nyid kyis phyir de nyid de rnams kyi nang du gnas pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis nam mkha'i phyogs su lus las shar ba na thim pa nyid kyis phyir de nyid de rnams kyi nang du gnas pa'i ye shes so //
translated: When they arise from the body in the direction of space, they dissolve into it, and thus the gnosis that resides within them is external.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / dad pa'i shugs kyis shes byas nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dad pa'i shugs kyis shes byas nas //
translated: having understood through the power of faith,

original: zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos des /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos des /
translated: by those dharmas of the side of enlightenment,

original: sngon gyi smon lam las dang @228b pa'i shugs kyi stobs kyi rjes su dran par byas pa dang snying stobs byas pas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam las dang @228b pa'i shugs kyi stobs kyi rjes su dran par byas pa dang snying stobs byas pas so //
translated: having remembered through the power of the strength of former aspirations and deeds, and having made courage,

original: de'i tshe skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa rnams kyi rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbye bas lus can thams cad kyi lus len par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa rnams kyi rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbye bas lus can thams cad kyi lus len par byed do //
translated: at that time, from the four modes of birth, all embodied beings take on bodies through the division of the subtle particles.

original: de ltar lus za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar lus za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, “eating the body” and so on.

original: sha chen zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems zhu ba la sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas za bor 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sha chen zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems zhu ba la sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas za bor 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Great flesh” is the eater through the previously explained reasoning of the melting of bodhicitta.

original: mi yi khrag ni 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: mi yi khrag ni 'thung ba'o //
translated: “Drinking human blood”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags chen po'i khrag 'thung bas he ru ka'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags chen po'i khrag 'thung bas he ru ka'i rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the form of Heruka by the blood of great passion.

original: de ltar slar yang gsal bar gsungs pa he ru ka ma zhes bya ba la sogs te 'dod chags chen po'i khrag rnams kyi byed pas he ru ka ma 'di rig ma ste /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang gsal bar gsungs pa he ru ka ma zhes bya ba la sogs te 'dod chags chen po'i khrag rnams kyi byed pas he ru ka ma 'di rig ma ste /
translated: Thus, again, it is stated clearly: Heruka, etc. This Heruka is the knowledge consort, by the action of the blood of great passion.

original: de nyid shing la reg pas yongs su gnas pa ste sngon du bshad pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shing la reg pas yongs su gnas pa ste sngon du bshad pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: She is the one who abides by touching the tree, as previously stated.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'jig rten yongs su rig pa'i rgyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten yongs su rig pa'i rgyur //
translated: For the sake of the knowledge of the world,

original: snying rje don chen byas nas ni //
analyzed: snying rje don chen byas nas ni //
translated: having made great compassion,

original: stong pa yis ni khyim dbus su //
analyzed: stong pa yis ni khyim dbus su //
translated: in the middle of the house of emptiness,

original: dbang po thams cad bza' bar bya //🔽de tshe yi shes lus su gnas //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad bza' bar bya // de tshe yi shes lus su gnas //
translated: one should eat all the sense faculties.🔽At that time, consciousness abides in the body,

original: 'dod chags kyis ni gang bar gnas //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni gang bar gnas //
translated: filled with passion.

original: rdzas rnams gcig gi dngos po ru //
analyzed: rdzas rnams gcig gi dngos po ru //
translated: The substances are one thing,

original: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran no //
translated: the atoms of earth, etc.

original: de yi 'jig rten kun 'gro ba //
analyzed: de yi 'jig rten kun 'gro ba //
translated: The world goes there

original: sngon gyi lus can stobs kyis so //
analyzed: sngon gyi lus can stobs kyis so //
translated: by the power of the previous body.

original: slar yang der ni byang chub che //
analyzed: slar yang der ni byang chub che //
translated: Again, there is great enlightenment

original: bsgrub pa byas pas nyams pa med //
analyzed: bsgrub pa byas pas nyams pa med //
translated: By performing the practice, there is no loss.

original: ces so // da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: ces so // da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa //
translated: Now, the meditation on the wheel of the maṇḍala is stated:

original: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: There, etc.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni le'u bco lnga par bshad pa der go bar bya'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni le'u bco lnga par bshad pa der go bar bya'o //
translated: The wheel of mind is to be understood as explained in chapter fifteen.

original: sngags kyi rnams yi ge las byung ba zhes bya ba ni ao ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis yang kun du spyod pa thim pa dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnams yi ge las byung ba zhes bya ba ni ao ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis yang kun du spyod pa thim pa dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: The mantras are born from the syllables, i.e., oṃ āḥ, etc. By this, the conduct, dissolution, enjoyment, etc. are explained.

original: nang du son pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i man ngag gis so //
analyzed: nang du son pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i man ngag gis so //
translated: By entering within, etc. is by the instruction of the verse.

original: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las 'jigs byed chen mo'i nang du son pa'i yi ge rnams kyi brda'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi mtshan nyid kyis dang de bzhin du ming gi yi ge'i dang
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las 'jigs byed chen mo'i nang du son pa'i yi ge rnams kyi brda'i phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi mtshan nyid kyis dang de bzhin du ming gi yi ge'i dang
translated: The Ship, a commentary on the great king of tantras of Yoginī, the glorious Ocean of Dakinis, explains the characteristics of the symbolic seals and the reply seals of the letters found within the great Vajravarahi.🔽

original: po rnams kyis mchog tu mya ngan las 'das par rab tu 'jug pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor bsgom pa'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan par bshad pa zhes bya ba ste le'u sum cu @229a * //
analyzed: po rnams kyis mchog tu mya ngan las 'das par rab tu 'jug pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor bsgom pa'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan par bshad pa zhes bya ba ste le'u sum cu @229a * //
translated: In the commentary on the great king of tantras of Yoginī, the Ocean of Dakas, called the Ship, the characteristics of the symbolic seals and the reply seals of the letters that are included in the great Vajra Speech are explained, and likewise, the characteristics of the supreme nirvāṇa through the first letters of the names and the characteristics of the method of meditating on the maṇḍala wheel are explained in detail.

original: rtsa lnga pa'i bshad pa'o /🔽// / thog mar rlung shugs mar btud nas //🔽'dod pa'i rnal 'byor ma mchog gi //
analyzed: rtsa lnga pa'i bshad pa'o / // / thog mar rlung shugs mar btud nas // 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor ma mchog gi //
translated: This is the explanation of the thirty-fifth chapter🔽on the characteristics of the seals in the great tantra

original: rang rang rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rang rang rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi //
translated: of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, the Heruka who is the sole hero,

original: de yi 'grel pa yang brjod bya //
analyzed: de yi 'grel pa yang brjod bya //
translated: the supreme secret of all the buddhas.🔽Homage to Pūraṇā

original: da ni rlung gi shugs can ma'i le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rlung gi shugs can ma'i le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of the thirty-sixth chapter, the chapter on Pūraṇā:🔽Homage to Pūraṇā.

original: de nas 'dod ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dod ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, “the desired one” and so forth.

original: 'dod ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i dngos grub ste rab mo ste /
analyzed: 'dod ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'i dngos grub ste rab mo ste /
translated: The “desired one” is the desired power of the yogins, the supreme one.

original: rnal 'byor ma zhing skyes ma la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhing skyes ma la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is the yoginīs born in the fields and so forth.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: phyag rgya'i brda ni byed pas zhes bya ba ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nye bar spyod pa rnams sna tshogs pa'i mdog las te de rnams brtse ba'i rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i brda ni byed pas zhes bya ba ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nye bar spyod pa rnams sna tshogs pa'i mdog las te de rnams brtse ba'i rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “By the sign of the consort,” that is, by the various colors of the enjoyments of the cause and effect that will be explained.

original: gang gis mdog dang bzhugs tshul mthong bas dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'grub par 'gyur te de rnams bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: gang gis mdog dang bzhugs tshul mthong bas dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'grub par 'gyur te de rnams bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
translated: The loving yogin sees the color and posture, and by the sign of the yogin’s former cause, it will be accomplished. Those will be explained.🔽That is the connection.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares that.

original: snang ba rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “In the appearances” and so forth.

original: dbang po rnams kyi gang dngos po'i spyod yul khams so so'i kun du spyod pa la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams su mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi gang dngos po'i spyod yul khams so so'i kun du spyod pa la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams su mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The elements are the objects of the senses, the individual elements of conduct, etc., and are seen in the consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: 'byung ba ste sems can thams cad kyi yang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya sngags kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba ste sems can thams cad kyi yang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyag rgya sngags kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The elements are the innate mudra-mantra-form of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar 'di'i slar yang ha h'a rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas h'a'i yi ge'i don gyi gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i slar yang ha h'a rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas h'a'i yi ge'i don gyi gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, here again, he says that the meaning of the syllable HA is clear, etc.🔽The root of the tree is the navel. That is the object of the senses.

original: shing gi rtsa bar zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i bar de dbang po'i spyod yul te de sbyor ba gnyis kyi snang ba de rnams pa bstan par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: shing gi rtsa bar zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i bar de dbang po'i spyod yul te de sbyor ba gnyis kyi snang ba de rnams pa bstan par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
translated: He says that in order to teach the appearance of those two yogas.

original: nag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sna tshogs ser skya'i mdog ces bya ba'i bar du de rnams sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sna tshogs ser skya'i mdog ces bya ba'i bar du de rnams sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The black, etc., up to the variegated pale-yellow color, those are the thirty-six.

original: rgyu gang rnams kyis zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu gang rnams kyis zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What are the causes? He says:🔽

original: kha dog thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste sngon du bshad pa'i kha dog rnams kyi gser la sogs pa'i khams pa bcu gnyis kyi mdog can te nyi ma zhes bya ba ni zangs so //
analyzed: kha dog thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste sngon du bshad pa'i kha dog rnams kyi gser la sogs pa'i khams pa bcu gnyis kyi mdog can te nyi ma zhes bya ba ni zangs so //
translated: All colors, etc. The colors mentioned previously are the colors of the twelve elements such as gold, etc. The sun is copper.

original: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de bzhin du gser ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gser ni khu ba'o //
translated: Similarly, gold is semen.

original: dngul ni rkang ngo //
analyzed: dngul ni rkang ngo //
translated: Silver is bone.

original: nyi ma ni khrag go //
analyzed: nyi ma ni khrag go //
translated: The sun is blood.

original: li gu mig ni chu rgyas so //
analyzed: li gu mig ni chu rgyas so //
translated: Cat's eye is urine.

original: zla 'od ni pags pa'o //🔽khar ba ni sha'o //
analyzed: zla 'od ni pags pa'o // khar ba ni sha'o //
translated: Moonstone is skin.🔽Coral is flesh.

original: ra gan ni rus pa'o //
analyzed: ra gan ni rus pa'o //
translated: Brass is bone.

original: phan tshun gyi mdog ni khams bdun zhu bas bshad pa dang gci ba dang bad kan dang @229b rlung dang mkhris pa rnams te khams bcu gnyis ni de rnams so //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi mdog ni khams bdun zhu bas bshad pa dang gci ba dang bad kan dang @229b rlung dang mkhris pa rnams te khams bcu gnyis ni de rnams so //
translated: The colors of the others are the seven elements explained as feces, urine, phlegm, wind, bile, and the twelve elements.

original: brtse ba che zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snang ba ye shes kyi rnam par 'gro ste /
analyzed: brtse ba che zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snang ba ye shes kyi rnam par 'gro ste /
translated: Great love is the light of the yogis who abide in the practice of the bodhisattvas, which goes in the form of gnosis.

original: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba la sogs pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: There and so on is explained as before.

original: gnyis dag gis zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang gi phyogs kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan la des phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan 'grub pa ste kha dog mthong zhing de dang phrang pas so //
analyzed: gnyis dag gis zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang gi phyogs kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan la des phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan 'grub pa ste kha dog mthong zhing de dang phrang pas so //
translated: “By both” means that by that, the cause, the mudrā and the reply of the mudrā are accomplished, seeing the color and being connected with it.

original: de ltar ci byas pa rnams su 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar ci byas pa rnams su 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa //
translated: What is done in that way?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan las dang phyis kyis te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan las dang phyis kyis te /
translated: “If” and so forth. The nature of the innate yoga is the cause, the clear light aspect itself, and later, by that.

original: mdor bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni mdor byas pa sngon bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //🔽da ni rnal 'byor ma 'di'i dang nye ba'i zhing dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang gsum gyi ming gi yi ge'i sgo nas lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni mdor byas pa sngon bzhin du 'gyur ba'o // da ni rnal 'byor ma 'di'i dang nye ba'i zhing dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang gsum gyi ming gi yi ge'i sgo nas lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: “In brief” means that it is done in brief, as before.

original: rlung shugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rlung shugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the innate yoga by means of the name syllables of the three, the field and the factors of enlightenment of this yoginī, he says, “Mārīcī” and so forth.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de'i rgyas par bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de'i rgyas par bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having taught the verse in brief, he says the extensive explanation:

original: 'bab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Falling” and so forth.

original: thog mar pa'i yi ge'i don no //
analyzed: thog mar pa'i yi ge'i don no //
translated: The meaning of the letter “a” is first.

original: 'bab pa dbu mar zhes bya ba ni dbu mar rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang ye shes kyi 'du shes can te /
analyzed: 'bab pa dbu mar zhes bya ba ni dbu mar rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang ye shes kyi 'du shes can te /
translated: “Falling into the central” means that at the time of falling into the central channel, the wind maṇḍala and the gnosis maṇḍala are conjoined.

original: sngon du 'di rnams la goms pa'i sbyor bas bstan par gyur pa des dmigs pa tsam gyis bag chags kyi stobs thams cad 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: sngon du 'di rnams la goms pa'i sbyor bas bstan par gyur pa des dmigs pa tsam gyis bag chags kyi stobs thams cad 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'o //
translated: By the yoga of previously cultivating these, by merely visualizing them, all the power of the latent tendencies “dies,” that is, degenerates.

original: de'i tshe ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas mu'i yi ge'i don te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas mu'i yi ge'i don te /
translated: At that time, “endowed” and so on is the meaning of the letter “u.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis so //
translated: [It is] half a verse.

original: de nas rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i yi ge'i don te phyed kyis so //
analyzed: de nas rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i yi ge'i don te phyed kyis so //
translated: Then, “knowledge” and so on is the meaning of the letter “o.” [It is] half a verse.

original: dam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis sa ga'i yi ge'i don te nges rim pa ji lta bas lam gsum po 'di'i de ltar rkyen gyis te /
analyzed: dam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis sa ga'i yi ge'i don te nges rim pa ji lta bas lam gsum po 'di'i de ltar rkyen gyis te /
translated: The meaning of the syllables of the sa section is explained in the second half of the verse, firmly, and so on.

original: de yang mthong ba dang sgom pa dang grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba dang sgom pa dang grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: Thus, the three paths are by the conditions of the three: seeing, cultivation, and liberation.🔽Thus, at one time is the time of equality.

original: de ltar dus gcig la chos thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa'i dus nyid sems dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dag gis rang gi bdag nyid kyis de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mthong ba ste mthong ba'i lam las bdag gi gdan no🔽// de ltar yang rig pa ni gzhan gyi @230a * //
analyzed: de ltar dus gcig la chos thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa'i dus nyid sems dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dag gis rang gi bdag nyid kyis de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mthong ba ste mthong ba'i lam las bdag gi gdan no // de ltar yang rig pa ni gzhan gyi @230a * //
translated: The seeing of the nature of all phenomena by the maṇḍala of mind and pristine consciousness is one's own seat.

original: gdan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gdan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: In that way, awareness is endowed with the seat of others.

original: bsgom pa'i bdag tu bya ba rnams kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i bdag tu bya ba rnams kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: The cultivation is the activity of the self.

original: lam nye bar zhi ba'o //🔽de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: lam nye bar zhi ba'o // de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The path is peace.

original: de kho na nyid mas dam du 'khyud ces bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mas dam du 'khyud ces bya ste /
translated: Having done that, it is said, embraced by the reality consort.

original: rgya che ba'i rnam par shes pas ye shes kyi aa wa dhu'u t'i la 'khyud pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub lam gyi rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i rnam par shes pas ye shes kyi aa wa dhu'u t'i la 'khyud pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub lam gyi rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: The great consciousness embraces the wisdom avadhūtī, and so there is the transformation into the path of the enlightenment of the simultaneously-arisen.

original: des grol ba'i lam rjes skyob rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang gi bag chags las byung ba rnams kyi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: des grol ba'i lam rjes skyob rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang gi bag chags las byung ba rnams kyi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The path of liberation is the subsequent protection of those, i.e., the transformations of the Buddhas, which arise from their own habitual tendencies.

original: phyi rol gyi don du'o /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du'o /
translated: They are external objects.

original: de ltar gang gi rnam par dag par 'gyur ba gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi rnam par dag par 'gyur ba gsungs pa //
translated: Thus, it is said that there is the purification of those.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste hri'i yi ge'i don des so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste hri'i yi ge'i don des so //
translated: The three aspects, etc., are by the meaning of the syllable hrīḥ.

original: thar pa rnams gsum zhes bya ste //
analyzed: thar pa rnams gsum zhes bya ste //
translated: The three liberations are

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og rnam par dag pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bdag nyid de rang gi lam la sogs pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og rnam par dag pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bdag nyid de rang gi lam la sogs pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
translated: The pure realms of heaven, the human world, and the underworld, which are of the nature of body, speech, and mind, on the path of seeing, etc., are one’s own path, etc., in the term.

original: de ltar mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sha'i yi ge'i don gyi sems bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sha'i yi ge'i don gyi sems bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, “equal” and so on explain the mind with the meaning of the syllable “sa”.

original: de bzhin du bum can zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku'i yi ge'i don gyi ngag bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bum can zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku'i yi ge'i don gyi ngag bshad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, “with vase” and so on explain speech with the meaning of the syllable “ku”.

original: de bzhin du min zhes bya ba la sogs pas na'i yi ge'i don gyis lus 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du min zhes bya ba la sogs pas na'i yi ge'i don gyis lus 'chad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, “not so” and so on explain the body with the meaning of the syllable “na”.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis so //
translated: [This is] with three and a half verses.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mnyam pa'i bde ba mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i bde ba mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: “Equal bliss is seen.”

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: This is the bliss of peace.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba'i dbus su gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba'i dbus su gnas //
translated: “Abiding in the middle of the blazing vajra”

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bu ga'i nang du 'pho ba med pa la gnas pa nyid pas sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam par mthong bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bu ga'i nang du 'pho ba med pa la gnas pa nyid pas sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam par mthong bas te /
translated: means that because of abiding in the non-transference within the vajra hole, the mind is seen in the aspect of luminosity.

original: de rdo rje 'bar ba'i nang du mnyam pa'i bde ba gnas zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de rdo rje 'bar ba'i nang du mnyam pa'i bde ba gnas zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: That is connected with “abiding in the middle of the blazing vajra, equal bliss.”

original: bum can la sogs byas gang phyir //
analyzed: bum can la sogs byas gang phyir //
translated: “Because of the vase and so on being made”

original: zhes bya ba ni de la dang h'a ra la sogs pas srog la sogs pa rnam par bzung ba ste des kyang bum pa can du 'gyur te lte ba'i dbus su thams cad du khyab pas na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la dang h'a ra la sogs pas srog la sogs pa rnam par bzung ba ste des kyang bum pa can du 'gyur te lte ba'i dbus su thams cad du khyab pas na'o //
translated: Here, with “and so on” and so forth, life and so on are taken up, and by that, the vase-breathing is accomplished, since all pervade the center of the navel.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dkyil 'khor thams cad de g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i bug dag gis bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dkyil 'khor thams cad de g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i bug dag gis bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The “and so on” includes all the maṇḍalas, accomplished by the left and right nostrils.

original: de'i phyir gtum mo'i 'dod chags chen po'i bdag nyid kyis thams cad rnam par za ba'o //
