translated: Having taken the cotton from the top of that skull, one should spin thread with the maiden

original: byas pa'i skud pa la dur khrod du sngon du bshad pa'i bu mo'i me tog bzung ste des skud pa la bsgos nas /
analyzed: byas pa'i skud pa la dur khrod du sngon du bshad pa'i bu mo'i me tog bzung ste des skud pa la bsgos nas /
translated: who has taken the flower of the maiden previously explained in the charnel ground.🔽Having spun the thread, one should tie it on whomever one wishes.🔽By the method of drawing blood, one should take the blood of that person.

original: sems can gang la bcings pa de'i yang khrag 'dren pa'i sbyor bas khrag bzung la khrag ces bya ba ni brgyab pa dang lhung bal sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: sems can gang la bcings pa de'i yang khrag 'dren pa'i sbyor bas khrag bzung la khrag ces bya ba ni brgyab pa dang lhung bal sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The blood is that of a person who has been struck, fallen, and so on.

original: @236b 'on kyang bya rgod kyi nor bu rnams kyis mi snang bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @236b 'on kyang bya rgod kyi nor bu rnams kyis mi snang bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the vulture jewel will make one invisible.

original: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rdo rje'i nor bur son par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus rnams su rang gis rig pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid du rang gi sems 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i nor bur son par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus rnams su rang gis rig pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid du rang gi sems 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Having reached the vajra gem” means that one’s mind is transformed into the nature of the union of self-awareness at the times of the innate joy.

original: de'i rnam pa dmigs pas sems can thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs thams cad 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dmigs pas sems can thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs thams cad 'grub pa'o //
translated: By observing that form, all the masses of karma of all sentient beings are accomplished.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the concise definitive meaning.

original: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nor bu'i nang du son par mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nor bu'i nang du son par mtshon par bya'o //
translated: “Yantra” should be illustrated as “having reached the vajra gem.”

original: de ltar khams kyi re'u mig ces bya ba ni gcig gis nyung ba'i lnga bcu'i khams de rnams te /🔽de yang gzugs la sogs pa la sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: de ltar khams kyi re'u mig ces bya ba ni gcig gis nyung ba'i lnga bcu'i khams de rnams te / de yang gzugs la sogs pa la sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: Thus, the “matrix of elements” is the fifty elements less one.

original: de bzhin du khrag dang khu ba dang rkang dang rus pa dang sha dang chu rgyus dang lpags pa dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang sha dang snabs dang lud pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khrag dang khu ba dang rkang dang rus pa dang sha dang chu rgyus dang lpags pa dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang sha dang snabs dang lud pa rnams te /
translated: Moreover, there are thirty-six elements, such as form, and likewise, blood, semen, bones, flesh, sinews, skin, wind, bile, phlegm, muscle, mucus, and phlegm.

original: de rnams kyi khams rnams la so sor re re rtsa rnams kyi bu ga dang bu ga'i dum bu rnams su de rnams kyi rdo rje nor bu'i bu gar bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi khams rnams la so sor re re rtsa rnams kyi bu ga dang bu ga'i dum bu rnams su de rnams kyi rdo rje nor bu'i bu gar bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the pores of the channels of those elements, in the parts of the pores, there is the bliss called the “pore of the vajra gem.”

original: rtsa phra mo'i gzugs can zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: rtsa phra mo'i gzugs can zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “having the form of subtle channels.”

original: der yi ge zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: der yi ge zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa ste /
translated: There, the “syllable” is the supreme, uncontaminated state.

original: des lha'i gzugs rnams ni rlung chen po'i rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des lha'i gzugs rnams ni rlung chen po'i rang bzhin rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the forms of the deities become the nature of the great winds.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is explained:

original: rlung gi phra mo'i gzugs kyi ni ;
analyzed: rlung gi phra mo'i gzugs kyi ni ;
translated: The subtle form of the wind

original: / ye shes de dang 'dres par son //
analyzed: / ye shes de dang 'dres par son //
translated: is the wisdom that has entered into that.

original: lha yi rnam pa'i gzugs bdag nyid //
analyzed: lha yi rnam pa'i gzugs bdag nyid //
translated: The form of the deity’s body

original: lus thams cad la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad la gnas pa'o //
translated: is present in all bodies.🔽The supreme, uncontaminated, perfect knowledge

original: nor bu'i nang son rtsa rnams kyi //🔽mchog tu zag med yang dag rigs //
analyzed: nor bu'i nang son rtsa rnams kyi // mchog tu zag med yang dag rigs //
translated: is present in the channels within the gem.

original: khams rnams la sogs de ltar du //
analyzed: khams rnams la sogs de ltar du //
translated: The elements and so on are like that,

original: sna tshogs bu ga las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs bu ga las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from various pores.

original: sems can kun gyis bdag nyid sems //
analyzed: sems can kun gyis bdag nyid sems //
translated: The mind of all sentient beings

original: 'dir ni rnam par bzung zhing bsam //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par bzung zhing bsam //
translated: is apprehended and contemplated here.

original: sku gsum don chen po ru ni //
analyzed: sku gsum don chen po ru ni //
translated: The great meaning of the three bodies

original: kha sbyar steng du 'bab pa po //
analyzed: kha sbyar steng du 'bab pa po //
translated: falls upon the union above.

original: de ru sprul pa'i las rnams ni //
analyzed: de ru sprul pa'i las rnams ni //
translated: There, the emanated actions

original: dbang la sogs pa kun du 'gro //
analyzed: dbang la sogs pa kun du 'gro //
translated: are the universal pervasion of the initiations, and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor rnam rtog thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam rtog thob bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain the yoga of conceptualization,

original: sangs rgyas gar mkhan gyis bstan to ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas gar mkhan gyis bstan to ;
translated: the Buddha, the dancer, teaches.

original: / spyi bor khams rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: / spyi bor khams rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: On the crown, all the elements

original: bag chags ri mo byed pa la'o //
analyzed: bag chags ri mo byed pa la'o //
translated: are painted with the patterns of traces.

original: sngags ni sa gsum gnon pa ste //
analyzed: sngags ni sa gsum gnon pa ste //
translated: The mantra is the subduer of the three worlds,

original: thabs dang shes rab rgyun mi 'chad //🔽ces bya'o // de ltar slar yang rdo rje phag mo'i thog mar sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams su mnyam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges @237a * //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rgyun mi 'chad // ces bya'o // de ltar slar yang rdo rje phag mo'i thog mar sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams su mnyam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges @237a * //
translated: the uninterrupted stream of means and wisdom.

original: pa'o // lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: pa'o // lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Thus, again, at the beginning of Vajravārāhī, one should equalize in the mantra maṇḍalas. This is the definitive meaning. The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel ba gru gzings las rdo rje phag mo dang gnyis su med pa'i ldang lha mo la sogs pa 'di'i sgo nas ye shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel ba gru gzings las rdo rje phag mo dang gnyis su med pa'i ldang lha mo la sogs pa 'di'i sgo nas ye shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan
translated: The chapter on the procedure of the arising of wisdom, which is the detailed explanation of the characteristics of the procedure called “The Arising of Wisdom,” from the commentary called “The Ship” on the great king of tantras of Yoginī, the glorious Ocean of Dakas,

original: pa ste / le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: pa ste / le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: is the explanation of the thirty-eighth chapter.

original: // / shing bzang rnal 'byor mar btud nas //
analyzed: // / shing bzang rnal 'byor mar btud nas //
translated: Having bowed to the excellent tree Yoginī,

original: ming yig rnams las byung ba yi //
analyzed: ming yig rnams las byung ba yi //
translated: the one arisen from the syllables of the name,

original: de yis de ltar 'dod kun nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ltar 'dod kun nyid //
translated: she, in that way, is the nature of all desires,

original: bsam pas dngos grub ster 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam pas dngos grub ster 'gyur te /
translated: granting spiritual powers by mere thought.

original: sna tshogs man ngag nges bsam pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs man ngag nges bsam pa //
translated: The various instructions are to be contemplated,

original: rnal 'byor ma kun bskyed pa ste //🔽'khrul 'khor 'khor lo bris pa yis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma kun bskyed pa ste // 'khrul 'khor 'khor lo bris pa yis //
translated: which generate all yoginīs.🔽The accomplishment of the nāgas of the family is here,

original: rigs kyi klu ni 'dir 'grub ste //
analyzed: rigs kyi klu ni 'dir 'grub ste //
translated: by drawing the machine wheel.🔽The explanation of the activity is

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi bzlas pa dang // dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bsgoms pa yis //🔽las byed pa yi 'grel bshad de //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi bzlas pa dang // dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bsgoms pa yis //🔽las byed pa yi 'grel bshad de //
translated: the recitation of the root mantra and the meditation on the maṇḍala, and so on.

original: rang gis mdor bstan rgyas bshad kyi'o //
analyzed: rang gis mdor bstan rgyas bshad kyi'o //
translated: By me, in brief and in detail.

original: zhes bya'o ; / da ni le'u sum cu rtsa dgu ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o ; / da ni le'u sum cu rtsa dgu ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of the thirty-ninth chapter is stated:

original: de nas slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste slar yang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yang so sor mtshon par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste slar yang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yang so sor mtshon par mdzad de /
translated: Then again, etc. Again means that the Bhagavān, by the previously explained speech, again individually illustrates.

original: 'dir so sor mtshon pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir so sor mtshon pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the individual illustration here?

original: gsungs pa / shin tu bzang mo'i rnal 'byor ma'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / shin tu bzang mo'i rnal 'byor ma'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is stated: The yoga of very good Yoginī, etc.

original: de'i sbyor ba slar yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba slar yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is her yoga again?

original: ming gi yi ge rnams su zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ming gi yi ge rnams su zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The syllables of the name, etc.

original: de ltar slar yang /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang /
translated: Thus, again:

original: lamba ka yi rab sbyor ba //
analyzed: lamba ka yi rab sbyor ba //
translated: The application of lambaka,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is stated.

original: lamba ka'i gnas kyi yi ge rnams kyis dang / byang chub kyi phyogs shes rab kyi stobs kyi las dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du rta'i 'gros zhes bya ba'i 'khrul 'khor rnams su bri ba la sogs pa so sor mtshon par mdzad pa de ltar mdor bstan pa'am mdor bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lamba ka'i gnas kyi yi ge rnams kyis dang / byang chub kyi phyogs shes rab kyi stobs kyi las dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du rta'i 'gros zhes bya ba'i 'khrul 'khor rnams su bri ba la sogs pa so sor mtshon par mdzad pa de ltar mdor bstan pa'am mdor bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: The letters of the Lampaka place, and the activity of the power of wisdom of the factors of enlightenment, and likewise the yantras called the “speed of the horse” are written and so forth, each one indicated. That should be known as the brief explanation or summary.

original: da ni 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa thog mar shes rab kyi stobs kyi yi ge la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa thog mar shes rab kyi stobs kyi yi ge la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, here the extensive explanation is first stated, the letters of the power of wisdom and so forth.

original: de ltar rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the “joy” and so forth.

original: bra'i yi ge'i don nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba'i sbyor ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bra'i yi ge'i don nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba'i sbyor ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: By the meaning of the letter “bra” itself, one abides in the application of joy.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi rigs pa rnams su gang bskyed pa rab tu dga' ba bsgrubs pa'i rnal @237b 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor bsgoms pas de rab tu dga' ba ste de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi rigs pa rnams su gang bskyed pa rab tu dga' ba bsgrubs pa'i rnal @237b 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor bsgoms pas de rab tu dga' ba ste de de bzhin no //
translated: That which is generated in the principles of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, the joy that is accomplished by the yogis who cultivate yoga, that is joy, just like that.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam pas byas pa'i snying rje des sems can dang rab tu phrad pas sems sdug bsngal bar 'gro ste 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam pas byas pa'i snying rje des sems can dang rab tu phrad pas sems sdug bsngal bar 'gro ste 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Because of being liberated from the suffering of cyclic existence, compassion that is done with a joyful intention goes to the suffering of sentient beings. This is the truth of suffering.

original: de'i phyir kun 'byung ste mchog tu dga' ba dang byams pa shin tu mthun pas sems can ma lus pa'i spyod pa dgrol pa'i rgyur sems rab tu 'gro ste 'di ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun 'byung ste mchog tu dga' ba dang byams pa shin tu mthun pas sems can ma lus pa'i spyod pa dgrol pa'i rgyur sems rab tu 'gro ste 'di ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the origin is the cause of liberating the conduct of all sentient beings, since it is the most joyful and loving. The mind goes to that. This is the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa yang bral ba'i dga' bas 'gro pa med pa'i btang snyoms bsgrub pa'i btang snyoms yod pa dang med pa'i chos spangs pas de bzhin du 'pho ba med par byed pas sems can smin pa'i rgyur sems rab tu 'gro ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang bral ba'i dga' bas 'gro pa med pa'i btang snyoms bsgrub pa'i btang snyoms yod pa dang med pa'i chos spangs pas de bzhin du 'pho ba med par byed pas sems can smin pa'i rgyur sems rab tu 'gro ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Also, cessation is the truth of cessation, since the mind goes to the cause of ripening sentient beings, by means of the equanimity that is accomplished by the equanimity of non-going through the abandonment of existent and non-existent phenomena by means of the joy of separation.

original: lam zhes bya ba la yang gnyis kyi dngos po dang bral ba des lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bar gnas te gang gi phyir rab tu dga' bas sems can thams cad kyis ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam gyi gzugs su sems rab tu
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba la yang gnyis kyi dngos po dang bral ba des lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bar gnas te gang gi phyir rab tu dga' bas sems can thams cad kyis ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam gyi gzugs su sems rab tu
translated: Because of the joy, the mind of all sentient beings goes to the form of the path of enlightenment in order to attain gnosis.

original: 'gro ba 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the path.

original: de ltar gang gis 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gang gis 'gro zhe na /
translated: By what means does one go?

original: dga' ba bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said, “the four joys,” and so on.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The root mantra is

original: rtsa ba'i sngags rkang ba bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can de'i rgyus te ci zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags rkang ba bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can de'i rgyus te ci zhe na /
translated: the root mantra with forty-eight lines. By that means, what?

original: ji ltar rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi de'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang / ming gi yi ge rnams su bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi de'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang / ming gi yi ge rnams su bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as all yoginīs are generated from the lines of his mantra and the syllables of his name.

original: bshad pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams kyis le'u dang be'u rnams su kun du spyod pa la sogs pas thim pa dang longs spyod pa dang khyab bdag nyid du son pa zhes bya bas dga' ba bzhi rnams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams kyis le'u dang be'u rnams su kun du spyod pa la sogs pas thim pa dang longs spyod pa dang khyab bdag nyid du son pa zhes bya bas dga' ba bzhi rnams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: By those characteristics of the explanation, in the months and half-months, through the conduct of the four joys, such as “dissolution, enjoyment, and the state of the lord of all,” the four joys are generated.

original: de la thim pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la thim pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Therein, the suffering of dissolution,

original: longs spyod pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: the enjoyment of the origin,

original: bdag tu byed pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu byed pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: the self-making of cessation,

original: khyab bdag nyid ni lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag nyid ni lam zhes bya'o //
translated: and the state of the lord of all is the path.

original: de ltar sngags shar ba rnams su dang / 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dus rnams su sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te dus thams cad du byang chub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar sngags shar ba rnams su dang / 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi dus rnams su sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te dus thams cad du byang chub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, in the months and half-months, the arising of the mantras, at the time of the twelve transits, suffering and so on occur, and at all times, there is awakening. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar slar yang thabs gang gis @238a * //
analyzed: de ltar slar yang thabs gang gis @238a * //
translated: Thus, again, by what means will that be?

original: 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The wisdom…

original: dzny'a'i yi ge'i don gyis te ye shes ldan zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid bsams pa sngon gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba de dang ldan pa sems can gyi don gyi rgyus te //
analyzed: dzny'a'i yi ge'i don gyis te ye shes ldan zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid bsams pa sngon gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba de dang ldan pa sems can gyi don gyi rgyus te //
translated: By the meaning of the syllable jña, “endowed with intuition” means that the yogi/nī who is endowed with the equality that is the nature of the prior thought, is endowed with that, and by the cause of the aim of sentient beings,

original: dbugs rgyu ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi kun du spyod pa rnams su nang du gnas pa nyid kyis phyi rol du gang 'dod pa de byed de des de dang 'dra ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi kun du spyod pa rnams su nang du gnas pa nyid kyis phyi rol du gang 'dod pa de byed de des de dang 'dra ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “the nature of the breath” means that by abiding internally in all the conduct of the channels, externally one does whatever one wishes. The meaning of “that mind” is like that.

original: de ltar kun rdzob bden pa bzung ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sems can rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo bzung nas byang chub sgrub par byed pas na brtan pa dang phrad pa las so zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob bden pa bzung ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sems can rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo bzung nas byang chub sgrub par byed pas na brtan pa dang phrad pa las so zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, “having taken up the conventional truth” means that having taken up the door of the conventional truth of sentient beings of saṃsāra, one accomplishes enlightenment. “By meeting with the steadfast” is the ascertainment.

original: de ltar byas pas 'jig rten 'di la yang mngon sum gyis dgos pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas 'jig rten 'di la yang mngon sum gyis dgos pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having done that, it is said that there is a purpose for the world by way of direct perception.

original: stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “power” and so forth are

original: ba la'i yi ge gnyis kyi don gyis te /
analyzed: ba la'i yi ge gnyis kyi don gyis te /
translated: by the meaning of the two syllables ba la.

original: las rnams su zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshogs rnams su stobs te nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams su zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshogs rnams su stobs te nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “In the actions” means in the collections of actions, the power, that is, the ability, arises.

original: de ltar rtsa'i kun du spyod pa las gang du zhugs pas nus mthur 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa'i kun du spyod pa las gang du zhugs pas nus mthur 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having entered into any of the conduct of the nāḍīs, the power arises.

original: yid bzang ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid bzang ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The good mind” and so on.

original: shin tu bzang mo'i yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba des ni /
analyzed: shin tu bzang mo'i yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba des ni /
translated: By the application of the syllable su bha,

original: thog ma nyid du su'i yi ge'i don gyis de de bzhin du bshad de /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du su'i yi ge'i don gyis de de bzhin du bshad de /
translated: at the beginning, the meaning of the syllable su is explained as such.

original: de ltar dbu ma'i nang du rab tu zhugs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma'i nang du rab tu zhugs pas so //
translated: Thus, by entering into the inner avadhūti,

original: 'dis kyang don dam pa'i bden pa 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis kyang don dam pa'i bden pa 'chad pa ste /
translated: this also explains the ultimate truth.

original: de rnams gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: That is clearly stated:

original: za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Eating” and so on.

original: bha'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: bha'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: By the meaning of the syllable bhu.

original: las chen po zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i nang gi bdag nyid kyi rig pas dang kun rdzob kyi bden pas so //
analyzed: las chen po zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i nang gi bdag nyid kyi rig pas dang kun rdzob kyi bden pas so //
translated: “Great action” is the inner reality explained previously and the relative truth.

original: de rnams kyang sems kyi zhen pa dang bral ba rnams su rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa 'di dang rtsa ba'i sngags kyi rgyus bshad pa'i rim pas rang bzhin du za bar gyur pa byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs par dgongs so
analyzed: de rnams kyang sems kyi zhen pa dang bral ba rnams su rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa 'di dang rtsa ba'i sngags kyi rgyus bshad pa'i rim pas rang bzhin du za bar gyur pa byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs par dgongs so
translated: Also, those who are free from mental attachment, who are of the nature of non-conceptuality, should eat naturally, by the process explained in the root mantra, as stated in the passage beginning “having made…”

original: // rang bzhin 'di rnams kyis ci'i gzugs ci las byung ba za zhe na /
analyzed: // rang bzhin 'di rnams kyis ci'i gzugs ci las byung ba za zhe na /
translated: What is the form of these natural ones, and from what do they eat?

original: gsungs pa / zhu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / zhu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: “melted…” and so on.

original: dri'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: dri'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: By the meaning of the syllable “dri,”

original: zhu byas bdud rtsi dron mo bcas //
analyzed: zhu byas bdud rtsi dron mo bcas //
translated: “melted, with warm nectar,”

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshams thams cad dril bu can gyi rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshams thams cad dril bu can gyi rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: means that in all the intervals, the bell-bearer is employed.

original: @238b 'dod chags chen po de dro ba ste de'i skad cig las so //
analyzed: @238b 'dod chags chen po de dro ba ste de'i skad cig las so //
translated: “Great passion” is its warmth, from that moment.

original: de'i dbus su ma bcos pa'i ngo bo'i 'khor lo 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzugs kyis gang bskyed pa de rnams bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ma bcos pa'i ngo bo'i 'khor lo 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzugs kyis gang bskyed pa de rnams bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the middle of that, those generated by the form of the unfabricated essence wheel, as will be explained, should be eaten. This is the meaning.

original: da ni lamba ka'i yi ge rnams kyi rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lamba ka'i yi ge rnams kyi rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now he teaches the application of the letters of the path.

original: bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Seven, etc.

original: lam gyi yi ge'i don gyis te sngon du bshad pa'i dril can ma yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yi ge'i don gyis te sngon du bshad pa'i dril can ma yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: By the meaning of the letters of the path, the earlier-explained “bell-ringer” should be explained.

original: 'phyang bar gyur pa byang chub sa bon zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi me tog lta bu 'phyang bar 'gyur ba kha 'og tu ba ltas pa'i rtsa snying ga'i dbus nas lte ba'i dbus su ngal sos brtan pa kshum gi rnam pa'i yi ge 'bar bzhin pa'i
analyzed: 'phyang bar gyur pa byang chub sa bon zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi me tog lta bu 'phyang bar 'gyur ba kha 'og tu ba ltas pa'i rtsa snying ga'i dbus nas lte ba'i dbus su ngal sos brtan pa kshum gi rnam pa'i yi ge 'bar bzhin pa'i
translated: The “hanging seed of enlightenment” is the fire-flower-like hanging, downward-facing channel, which is the channel in the center of the heart, which goes to the center of the navel, the resting place, the letter in the form of kṣuṃ, blazing.

original: gtum mo mtshon bya mtshon pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon gyi sems sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can der dbus su snying ga dang lte ba dag tu 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gtum mo mtshon bya mtshon pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon gyi sems sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can der dbus su snying ga dang lte ba dag tu 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The seed of the mind of enlightenment, which is the indicated object of caṇḍālī, the mind consisting of thirty-seven, goes there, to the center, to the heart and navel.

original: de ltar de'i sa bon gyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar de'i sa bon gyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Thus he teaches the etymology of its seed.

original: me zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: me zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: Fire, etc.

original: pa'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: pa'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: By the meaning of the letters of the path.

original: me'i rnam ba'i lha mo de //
analyzed: me'i rnam ba'i lha mo de //
translated: The goddess of the form of fire🔽

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning:🔽The goddess in the form of the syllable kṣuṃ of fire is the principal one, like a mother to her own maṇḍala.

original: me'i yi ge kshum gyi yi ge'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lha mo'i rnam pa gtso mo rang gi dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi ma lta bu ste de rnams kyis snying gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ste sems nyid pha'o //
analyzed: me'i yi ge kshum gyi yi ge'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lha mo'i rnam pa gtso mo rang gi dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi ma lta bu ste de rnams kyis snying gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ste sems nyid pha'o //
translated: They are the heart, the mind itself, the father.

original: de dag gis dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the maṇḍala and the maṇḍala-holders.

original: de ltar slar yang dril can ma'i sa bon gyis yi ge dang / rtsa'i rang bzhin cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang dril can ma'i sa bon gyis yi ge dang / rtsa'i rang bzhin cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, again, the seed of the conch-born one, the syllable, and the nature of the nāḍī, are stated:

original: keng rus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: keng rus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The skeleton,” and so on.

original: ka'i yi ge'i don nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ka'i yi ge'i don nyid kyis so //
translated: The meaning of the syllable ka.

original: keng rus rnam par shes pa'i rlung //
analyzed: keng rus rnam par shes pa'i rlung //
translated: The skeleton is the consciousness vāyu.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir keng rus kyi sgras dril can ma ste rlung gi yi ge'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa ye shes dang bcas pa dang / lha mo dang thabs rig pa'i gzugs can byang chub kyi sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir keng rus kyi sgras dril can ma ste rlung gi yi ge'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa ye shes dang bcas pa dang / lha mo dang thabs rig pa'i gzugs can byang chub kyi sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “goddess” is the form of the knowledge of the method, the seed of enlightenment.

original: der bdag nyid kyis dur khrod du phyin nas zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas las rang gi lus 'dor ba dang ldan pas dur khrod ces bya bar mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: der bdag nyid kyis dur khrod du phyin nas zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas las rang gi lus 'dor ba dang ldan pas dur khrod ces bya bar mngon par brjod do //
translated: “Having gone to the charnel ground by oneself” means that one’s own body is discarded in that place, and so it is called a “charnel ground.”

original: phra mo ye shes kyi rnam par rlung gi srog 'bab pas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'gro ba ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi @239a * //
analyzed: phra mo ye shes kyi rnam par rlung gi srog 'bab pas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su 'gro ba ste / sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi @239a * //
translated: “One should go to the buddhafields by oneself” means that one should go to the buddhafields by the subtle wisdom wind.

original: rang bzhin rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “By means of the forms of the buddhas” means by the nature of the forms of the buddhas.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de ltar 'di'i sa bon gyi yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i sa bon gyi yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad pa ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the term “seed syllable” and so on is explained in that way.

original: de'i sa bon gyi yi ge'i dbus su slar yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi yi ge'i dbus su slar yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of the seed-syllable, one should meditate again on the mantra-syllable, which will be explained.

original: de ltar re re'i zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyi mthar ro //
analyzed: de ltar re re'i zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyi mthar ro //
translated: Thus, of each is at the end of the mantra-syllable.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can de'i de ltar yi ge rnams sna tshogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams 'phro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can de'i de ltar yi ge rnams sna tshogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams 'phro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The root mantra is the one consisting of forty-eight lines. The meaning is that the various yoginis of the syllables radiate from that.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa ;
translated: Now, the meditation on the mandala-circle is stated:

original: aom aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Om, A, etc. The mandala-circle is to be meditated on in the previously explained sequence.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i dril can ma'i gsang ba rnams su ste rlung gi lte bar te de'i dbus su sbyor ba'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i dril can ma'i gsang ba rnams su ste rlung gi lte bar te de'i dbus su sbyor ba'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The secret is the previously explained secret of the bell-woman, in the navel of the wind, in the middle of that, the nature of the nectar of union.

original: bdud rtsi'i 'od bzhin gdan bzhi'i rim pa ste gang gi phyir der gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i 'od bzhin gdan bzhi'i rim pa ste gang gi phyir der gsungs pa'o //
translated: The stages of the Caturpīṭha are like the light of nectar, because it is taught there.

original: de ltar dang por byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar dang por byas nas /
translated: Having done that first,

original: phyi nas las ni yang dag brtsam //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi nas las ni yang dag brtsam // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then one should commence the rite.🔽The stages of the machine wheel of the nāgas and so forth are

original: klu la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pa ste de rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo gsungs pa /
analyzed: klu la sogs pas 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pa ste de rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo gsungs pa /
translated: taught in the statement of the machine wheel of those,

original: 'khrul 'khor 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the machine wheel, and so forth.

original: de ltar sngon mo'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni gcig gis dman pa'i dum bu lnga bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de ltar sngon mo'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni gcig gis dman pa'i dum bu lnga bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The form of the blue one is the one less than fifty parts.

original: de rnams su sngags kyi tshig dgod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams su sngags kyi tshig dgod pa gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of the placement of the mantra words in those is

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni yi ge aom mo //
translated: Vairocana is the syllable oṃ.

original: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dum bu thog mar dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma zhes bya ba ni dum bu thog mar dgod par bya'o //
translated: The first is the first part that should be placed.

original: rig byed kyi dang po yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: rig byed kyi dang po yi ge aom mo //
translated: The first of the Vedas is the syllable oṃ.

original: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni klu dgug pa dang dbang du bya ba dang lha rnams kyi gsang pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni klu dgug pa dang dbang du bya ba dang lha rnams kyi gsang pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summoning of the nāgas, bringing them under power, and the secret of the gods is stated:

original: klu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: klu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words “the nāgas” and so on indicate the brief teaching.

original: sogs pa'i sgras mi la sogs pa rnams la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mi la sogs pa rnams la byed pa'o //
translated: The word “and so on” refers to humans and so on.

original: 'o na theg pa thams cad du sangs rgyas pa rnams snying rje can rnams kyi srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang bral ba snying rje chen po can rnams kyi ngag tu bton pa tsam gyis kyang srog gcod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na theg pa thams cad du sangs rgyas pa rnams snying rje can rnams kyi srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang bral ba snying rje chen po can rnams kyi ngag tu bton pa tsam gyis kyang srog gcod par 'gyur na /
translated: If all the Buddhas, who are compassionate, are free from killing and so on, and the Great Compassionate Ones are free from killing and so on even by mere verbal expression,

original: ci ltar @239b mngon sum du byed par nus ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar @239b mngon sum du byed par nus ce na /
translated: how can they be able to do it in actuality?

original: mi nus pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi nus pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that they cannot.

original: de ni bden te 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig gis mi 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni bden te 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig gis mi 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: That is true, but it is said that they do not change through the words of the Blessed One.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Always” and so on.

original: dus thams cad du smon lam la sogs pas byang chub kyi bar du rnal 'byor la goms par byed pa'i dus rnams su'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du smon lam la sogs pas byang chub kyi bar du rnal 'byor la goms par byed pa'i dus rnams su'o //
translated: At all times, through aspirations and so on, up to enlightenment, they cultivate yoga.

original: brtse ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems gsad pa de drug pa'i don gyis dang po de rang gi sems gsod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtse ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems gsad pa de drug pa'i don gyis dang po de rang gi sems gsod par byed pa ste /
translated: The yogi who has the nature of compassion kills his own mind, by the meaning of the sixth [verse].

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: He kills his own mind, by the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: yang na slar yang zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i sems can rnams bstan pa la gnod pa byed pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byed pa de rnams kyi grol ba'i rgyur brtse ba bskyed pa la sogs pa byas nas sngon du bshad pa'i'o //
analyzed: yang na slar yang zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i sems can rnams bstan pa la gnod pa byed pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byed pa de rnams kyi grol ba'i rgyur brtse ba bskyed pa la sogs pa byas nas sngon du bshad pa'i'o //
translated: Or else, “again” refers to those sentient beings who are hostile, who harm the teachings, and who commit the five heinous acts. Having generated compassion and so forth for them, he does as previously explained.

original: lha rnams ji ltar de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha rnams ji ltar de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: How are the gods? He says:

original: sdang ba'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdang ba'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa la byed pa'o //
translated: The hostile gods, nagas, yakshas, and so forth.

original: de ji ltar sdang na de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar sdang na de gsungs pa /
translated: How are they hostile? He says:

original: drag bos grong khyer sum brtsegs bsregs //🔽khyab 'jug gis ni thams cad dkrugs //
analyzed: drag bos grong khyer sum brtsegs bsregs // khyab 'jug gis ni thams cad dkrugs //
translated: Rudra burned the three-storied city.🔽Vishnu churned the entire world.

original: thams cad bdag nyid tshangs pas sprul //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid tshangs pas sprul //
translated: Brahma emanated the entire world.

original: de bzhin slar la sdud par byed //
analyzed: de bzhin slar la sdud par byed //
translated: And likewise, he will again destroy it.

original: dgra bcom gyis ni sdig byas te //
analyzed: dgra bcom gyis ni sdig byas te //
translated: The Arhats committed sins.

original: koo la sogs byung rnam par shes //
analyzed: koo la sogs byung rnam par shes //
translated: The gods Kauśika and so forth were conscious.

original: lha yi bla mas skye rnams kyi//
analyzed: lha yi bla mas skye rnams kyi//
translated: The gods Brahmā and so forth

original: 'dod pa byas pa gcod pa yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa byas pa gcod pa yin //
translated: cut off the desires of beings.

original: bram ze nyi ma yi lha can //
analyzed: bram ze nyi ma yi lha can //
translated: The brahmin Sūryadeva

original: skyob pa rnams kyis ba lang gsad //🔽de ltar sdang ba byed rnams kyi //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams kyis ba lang gsad // de ltar sdang ba byed rnams kyi //
translated: was killed by the protectors.🔽Thus, the killers

original: nges par gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: are definitely killed by the angry ones.

original: bde gshegs snying rjes brlan pa yis //
analyzed: bde gshegs snying rjes brlan pa yis //
translated: The Sugata, moistened with compassion,

original: bdag nyid dmyal sogs 'gro ba mchog / ces so //
analyzed: bdag nyid dmyal sogs 'gro ba mchog / ces so //
translated: himself goes to the best of migrations, the hells and so forth.

original: 'on kyang lha rnams sogs pa 'di rnams rang rang gi dus su 'byung ba la rang bzhin gyi chos kyi 'byung gnas su gsad pa des dmigs pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang lha rnams sogs pa 'di rnams rang rang gi dus su 'byung ba la rang bzhin gyi chos kyi 'byung gnas su gsad pa des dmigs pa med pas so //
translated: Moreover, these gods and so forth, when they arise in their own time, are killed in the natural abodes of Dharma. Because of the absence of reference points,

original: slar yang mngon sum du byed pa ni min no //
analyzed: slar yang mngon sum du byed pa ni min no //
translated: they are not killed again in a direct way.

original: phyi rol du dran pas kyang phyag la sogs pa mi bya'o zhes 'jig rten du de ltar rang tu grags pas 'jig rten gyi bya ba la gcig mi rnams mi chen po rnams kyi dam pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pas bsad pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du dran pas kyang phyag la sogs pa mi bya'o zhes 'jig rten du de ltar rang tu grags pas 'jig rten gyi bya ba la gcig mi rnams mi chen po rnams kyi dam pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pas bsad pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Also, externally, one should not perform prostrations, etc. with mindfulness, because it is well known in the world that one who does not perform the worldly activities is like one who is dead.

original: des zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The word thus means in that way, as explained above.

original: de'i phyir rang gi sems bsad pas thams cad gsad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi sems bsad pas thams cad gsad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by killing one's own mind, all are killed.

original: @240a * // de'i phyir des bsad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig de de bzhin no //
analyzed: @240a * // de'i phyir des bsad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig de de bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the words by that, killing, etc. are just so.

original: de ltar las thams cad cho ga ji lta bus bya ba rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar las thams cad cho ga ji lta bus bya ba rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having stated how all activities should be performed,

original: bde mchog phyi ma rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde mchog phyi ma rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he says, in the later Supreme Bliss,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bya ba ste /
translated: which means that one should perform [the activities] following the explanatory tantras such as the Vajradaka.

original: gang cung zad dbang gi las la sogs pa 'dir gsungs pa gang de thams cad ji lta ba'i cho gas nges par gor ma chag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang cung zad dbang gi las la sogs pa 'dir gsungs pa gang de thams cad ji lta ba'i cho gas nges par gor ma chag par bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever little bit of the rite of power, etc. is taught here, all of that is to be done without fail according to the rite.

original: rang gi sems kyis de ltar zhes bya ba la dgongs pa'i don to //🔽de ltar 'dir bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho 'dir mdor bsdus pas man ngag rnams kyis lhan cig las re re'i cung zad bshad par bya //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis de ltar zhes bya ba la dgongs pa'i don to // de ltar 'dir bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho 'dir mdor bsdus pas man ngag rnams kyis lhan cig las re re'i cung zad bshad par bya //
translated: One's mind should be like that is the meaning of the intention.

original: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Thus, it is to be explained here is connected with a little bit of each rite together with the instructions is to be explained here in this Ocean of Dakas by way of a summary.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares just that:

original: klu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: klu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the nāgas, etc.

original: mtha' nas rim pas zhes bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma re re la klu'i rgyal po brgyad re re ste rtsa'i yi ges kyang klu'i rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba dang / mtha' yas kyis gnon pa ni 'og dang steng gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: mtha' nas rim pas zhes bya ba ni padma'i 'dab ma re re la klu'i rgyal po brgyad re re ste rtsa'i yi ges kyang klu'i rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba dang / mtha' yas kyis gnon pa ni 'og dang steng gi dbye bas so //
translated: From the end is the eight nāga kings on each petal of the lotus. The channel letters are the nāga kings Ananta and Takṣaka, below and above, respectively.

original: de ltar slar yang snying ga'i padma shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang snying ga'i padma shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, again, the lotus of the heart is to be known.

original: des srog ni nor rgyas 'dis so //
analyzed: des srog ni nor rgyas 'dis so //
translated: By this, life; by this, wealth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o /🔽da ni rlung klu'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi las mdzad par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o / da ni rlung klu'i rgyal po'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi las mdzad par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
translated: and so on.

original: dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, intending to explain the function of these winds, which are the nature of the naga kings, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Attracting, and so on. ”

original: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni srog dgang bas te /
analyzed: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni srog dgang bas te /
translated: “By entering” is by filling the life [wind].

original: 'gengs pa'i dus su ji srid aa wa dh'u t'ir rlung thams cad mi 'jug pa de srid du dgang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gengs pa'i dus su ji srid aa wa dh'u t'ir rlung thams cad mi 'jug pa de srid du dgang bar bya ste /
translated: At the time of filling, one should fill for as long as all the winds do not enter the avadhūti.

original: 'dis klu rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis klu rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, the nagas are attracted.

original: 'di ltar 'di rnams kyi gtong bas gshegs su gsol ba zhes bya ba ni klu rnams kyis grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di rnams kyi gtong bas gshegs su gsol ba zhes bya ba ni klu rnams kyis grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, “by releasing, one should request departure” is the liberation of the nagas.

original: char dbab pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du de srid du gtang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: char dbab pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du de srid du gtang bar bya ba ste /
translated: “For the sake of rain” is that one should release externally for as long as [the winds] dissolve there.

original: ji srid der thim nas song gi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid der thim nas song gi bar du'o //
translated: That is for as long as they dissolve and go there.

original: des de ltar gtong ba dang 'gengs pa dag gis char dbab pa bum pa can gyis bya ste /
analyzed: des de ltar gtong ba dang 'gengs pa dag gis char dbab pa bum pa can gyis bya ste /
translated: By that, one should cause rain by releasing and filling with the vase [breath].

original: ji srid byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa des de ltar char 'bebs par 'gyur te rtsa ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: ji srid byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa des de ltar char 'bebs par 'gyur te rtsa ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: As long as the bodhicitta descends, it rains in that way, by the root yoga.

original: de ltar char ches pa sel ba //
analyzed: de ltar char ches pa sel ba //
translated: Thus, the excess rain is removed.

original: zhes bya ba ni char ches pa bzlog pa ste mnyam pa'i rlung gis rnam par thim pa na byang chub kyi sems @240b rengs par gyur te phyi rol du yang nges de bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni char ches pa bzlog pa ste mnyam pa'i rlung gis rnam par thim pa na byang chub kyi sems @240b rengs par gyur te phyi rol du yang nges de bzhin no //
translated: The excess rain is removed, when the wind of equality dissolves, the bodhicitta becomes paralyzed, and externally, it is just so.

original: klu mo rnams 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nor rgyas la sogs pa'i chung ma de rnams kyang de nyid byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu mo rnams 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nor rgyas la sogs pa'i chung ma de rnams kyang de nyid byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nāḍīs of the nāgas here are the nature of the consciousnesses. The wives of Vāsuki and so on are also made of that.

original: de ltar thabs gang gis na bum pa can la sogs par 'gyur ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'gyur ba gsungs pa /🔽phu: yi ge brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar thabs gang gis na bum pa can la sogs par 'gyur ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'gyur ba gsungs pa / phu: yi ge brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, by what method does the vase and so on become full?🔽The eight syllables🔽are the eight syllables of the eight nāgas.

original: brgyad brgyad ces bya ba ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ste klu re re la brgyad brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyad brgyad ces bya ba ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ste klu re re la brgyad brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Eight times eight is sixty-four. Each nāga has eight.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs de bzhin zhes bya ba ste /🔽re re la srog la sogs rim pa ji lta bas 'pho ba so so'i dbye ba rnams kyis gnas brgyad rnams su /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs de bzhin zhes bya ba ste / re re la srog la sogs rim pa ji lta bas 'pho ba so so'i dbye ba rnams kyis gnas brgyad rnams su /
translated: Moreover, the various aspects of samādhi are “just so.”

original: phu:'i yi ge brgyad nye bar dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: phu:'i yi ge brgyad nye bar dgod par bya'o //
translated: In each of them, the eight locations are to be assigned the eight syllables of PHU, and so on, in order.🔽The heart, throat, navel, head, crown, secret place, the opening of

original: de la snying ga dang mgrin pa dang lte ba dang mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i bu ga dang sna'i rtse mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la snying ga dang mgrin pa dang lte ba dang mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i bu ga dang sna'i rtse mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the jewel, and the tip of the nose.

original: de ltar ji lta ba'i rim pas 'di rnams su klu'i rgyal po'i rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ji lta ba'i rim pas 'di rnams su klu'i rgyal po'i rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In this way, in accordance with the sequence, these are to be arranged as the kings of the nāgas.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: nor rgyas lte ba'i dbus su ste //
analyzed: nor rgyas lte ba'i dbus su ste //
translated: Vāsuki is in the center of the navel.

original: snying ga ru ni dung skyong ngo //
analyzed: snying ga ru ni dung skyong ngo //
translated: Śaṅkhapāla is in the heart.

original: mgrin pa ru ni padma'i klu //
analyzed: mgrin pa ru ni padma'i klu //
translated: Padmanāga is in the throat.

original: padma chen po mgo bo ste //
analyzed: padma chen po mgo bo ste //
translated: Mahāpadma is in the head.

original: spyi bo'i gtsug tu 'jog po'o //
analyzed: spyi bo'i gtsug tu 'jog po'o //
translated: Kālika is in the crown of the head.

original: gsang bar hu lu hu lu 'dod //
analyzed: gsang bar hu lu hu lu 'dod //
translated: Hulu hulu is in the secret place.

original: stobs rgyu nor bu'i bu gar ro //
analyzed: stobs rgyu nor bu'i bu gar ro //
translated: Jyotiṣka is in the opening of the jewel.

original: mtha' yas sna yi rtse mor ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas sna yi rtse mor ro //
translated: The infinite [syllables] are at the tip of the nose.

original: rgyal dang rnam rgyal de bzhin 'dir //
analyzed: rgyal dang rnam rgyal de bzhin 'dir //
translated: The [syllables] Jina and Vijaya are here

original: rkang mthil dang ni mgo dag tu //
analyzed: rkang mthil dang ni mgo dag tu //
translated: at the soles of the feet and the head.

original: tshigs rnams kun du khyab par ro //
analyzed: tshigs rnams kun du khyab par ro //
translated: They pervade all the joints.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rtogs pa sla'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rtogs pa sla'o //
translated: All the rest is easy to understand.

original: de ltar thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams su bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the yantras of Vajravārāhī's root mantra should be done.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i sngags dang de bzhin du shin tu bzang mo'i rtsa ba'i sngags gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid dang ming gi yi ge rnams
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i sngags dang de bzhin du shin tu bzang mo'i rtsa ba'i sngags gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid dang ming gi yi ge rnams
translated: In the commentary on the great tantra king of yoginīs, the glorious Ocean of Dakas, the ship, the root mantra of the Blessed One and likewise the root mantra of Subhadrā are nondual, with the nature of the syllables of the name.

original: dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag po dang las kyi tshogs kyi mtshams sbyor gyi skad cig gis gsad pa la sogs pas dang klu dgug pa la sogs pas dang rta'i 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa @241a * //
analyzed: dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag po dang las kyi tshogs kyi mtshams sbyor gyi skad cig gis gsad pa la sogs pas dang klu dgug pa la sogs pas dang rta'i 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa @241a * //
translated: the lord of the mandala circle, and the instant of the application of the assembly of rites, by killing, etc., and by summoning the nāgas, etc., and the characteristics of the ritual of the horse-riding machine are taught extensively.

original: ste ; le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: ste ; le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the thirty-ninth chapter.

original: // /'khor ba las sgrol khyab bdag mo //🔽rta rna ma la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: // /'khor ba las sgrol khyab bdag mo // rta rna ma la phyag byas nas //
translated: Homage to the all-pervading lady who liberates from saṃsāra,🔽the goddess Hayakarṇī.

original: las kyi sbyor bar lha mo de //
analyzed: las kyi sbyor bar lha mo de //
translated: In the application of rites, that goddess🔽brings the adept from the place

original: gnas nas sgrub byed sgrub pa po //
analyzed: gnas nas sgrub byed sgrub pa po //
translated: of the one to be accomplished,

original: sdang ba'i sems can rnams gsod par //
analyzed: sdang ba'i sems can rnams gsod par //
translated: and kills hateful beings.

original: byed de de ni dmigs pas so //
analyzed: byed de de ni dmigs pas so //
translated: That is done by visualizing her.

original: bdag gis sems can dgongs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can dgongs pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings,

original: de yi don gsal bri bar bya //
analyzed: de yi don gsal bri bar bya //
translated: I will clarify her meaning and write about it.

original: da ni rta rna ma'i le'u bzhi bcu pa'i bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rta rna ma'i le'u bzhi bcu pa'i bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: Now, it is said that the explanation of the fortieth chapter on Hayakarṇī is as follows:

original: de nas de'i phyir slar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i phyir slar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, after that, again, etc.

original: le'u sngon ma'i rjes su rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rnams the tshom dang ldan pas des slar yang rdo rje phag mos ji lta ba'i mchod pa bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka la byas pas de bzhin de des mnyes pa ste /
analyzed: le'u sngon ma'i rjes su rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rnams the tshom dang ldan pas des slar yang rdo rje phag mos ji lta ba'i mchod pa bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka la byas pas de bzhin de des mnyes pa ste /
translated: After the previous chapter, Vajravarahi and so forth, being doubtful, again, as before, Vajravarahi made an offering to glorious Heruka, the Bhagavat, and he was pleased.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru kas mngon par mdzad pa 'di gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru kas mngon par mdzad pa 'di gsungs pa /
translated: The deity is glorious Heruka, who spoke this:

original: rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Horse-face and so forth.

original: rta rna ma dang kanytsi dang ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de rnams kyi ming gi yi ge rnams kyi rab tu sbyor bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pa rnams kyis yi ge re re'i nges pa'i tshig rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar
analyzed: rta rna ma dang kanytsi dang ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de rnams kyi ming gi yi ge rnams kyi rab tu sbyor bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pa rnams kyis yi ge re re'i nges pa'i tshig rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar
translated: The names of Horse-face, Kankala, and the branch of enlightenment of correct samadhi are the individual syllables, which are to be explained by the sequence of the etymologies of the individual syllables, as will be explained.

original: 'brel to // de ltar yang thams cad kyi ming gi yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba bsdus pa'i don gyi gnas gang du gnas zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'brel to // de ltar yang thams cad kyi ming gi yi ge'i nges pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba bsdus pa'i don gyi gnas gang du gnas zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, where is the place of the collected meaning of the application of the etymologies of the syllables of all the names?

original: snying ga ru ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: snying ga ru ni yang dag gnas //
translated: abides in the heart.

original: zhes bya ba te snying po'i don 'dir snying ga'i don no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba te snying po'i don 'dir snying ga'i don no //
translated: In this context, the meaning of the heart is the heart center.🔽One should meditate in its center.

original: de'i dbus su bsgom par bya ba ste de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bsgom par bya ba ste de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states that:

original: ha yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ha yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The letter ha, etc.

original: thog ma nyid du rta rna ma'i yi ge rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du rta rna ma'i yi ge rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: First of all, the letters of Hayagriva are to be explained.

original: des ha'i yi ge n'a da las zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i thig le tsam mo //
analyzed: des ha'i yi ge n'a da las zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i thig le tsam mo //
translated: The letter ha is from nada, that is, it is the mere drop of bliss.

original: lus kun zhes bya ba ni lte ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de thams cad du ste /
analyzed: lus kun zhes bya ba ni lte ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo de thams cad du ste /
translated: The word entire means in all the chakras of the navel, etc.

original: snying ga'i dbus las kyang ni langs //
analyzed: snying ga'i dbus las kyang ni langs //
translated: It arises from the center of the heart.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtum mo de nyid de ltar n'a da'i bdag nyid can ye shes kyi 'od gsal ba des te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtum mo de nyid de ltar n'a da'i bdag nyid can ye shes kyi 'od gsal ba des te /
translated: That candali, in that way, is the nature of nada, and with that light of gnosis,

original: kyang gi yi ge ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi yi ge ni sdud pa'o //
translated: the syllable ka is the collection.

original: de ltar byung ba gang gis yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba gang gis yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If it is asked by whom does that arise, it is said:

original: ya'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: ya'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: By the meaning of the syllable ya.

original: de ltar ya yig 'gro 'ong zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ste he ra no dang dh'a tu bhe ri ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ya yig 'gro 'ong zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ste he ra no dang dh'a tu bhe ri ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus, the syllable ya is called “coming and going.” It is the coming and going of the entire body. Herana means “going,” and dhatubherini means “coming.”

original: ci @241b 'gro gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci @241b 'gro gsungs pa /
translated: What is it that goes?

original: srog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “life.”

original: 'dir srog gi sgras sems la bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir srog gi sgras sems la bshad do //
translated: Here, the word “life” is explained as the mind.

original: cis she na srog chags thams cad kyi nang du gyur pa nyid kyis srog ni sems so zhes bya bar byas nas /
analyzed: cis she na srog chags thams cad kyi nang du gyur pa nyid kyis srog ni sems so zhes bya bar byas nas /
translated: Why? Because it is the life of all living beings, life is made to be the mind.

original: rdo rje'i rlung gis bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni thig le brjod du med pa des bskul ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rlung gis bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni thig le brjod du med pa des bskul ba ste /
translated: It is “agitated by the vajra wind,” that is, it is impelled by the inexpressible drop.

original: mdor na gang rnam par rtog pa thams cad des bsregs pas sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na gang rnam par rtog pa thams cad des bsregs pas sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In brief, since it burns all conceptual thoughts, the mind goes to its natural luminosity. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar yang rtsa'i gtso bo snying ga dang lte ba'i 'khor lo gnyis su rdo rje'i rlung la brten pa rnams kyi ka'i yi ge rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar yang rtsa'i gtso bo snying ga dang lte ba'i 'khor lo gnyis su rdo rje'i rlung la brten pa rnams kyi ka'i yi ge rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: Thus, the principal channel is the two cakras at the heart and navel. The syllable ka is placed in those that are based on the vajra wind.

original: de nyid gsungs pa du zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa du zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is stated in “How many?” and so forth.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: [There are] two verses.

original: de ltar nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi 'dab ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i padma'i 'dab ma so sor de nyid dga' bas rtsa'i tshad du zhig de rnams kyi tshad du gyur ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi 'dab ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i padma'i 'dab ma so sor de nyid dga' bas rtsa'i tshad du zhig de rnams kyi tshad du gyur ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, on the twenty-eight petals, that is, on the individual petals of the heart lotus, how many are the measures of the channels? What is their measure?

original: de rnams ston pa ni slar yang gsum gsum zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams ston pa ni slar yang gsum gsum zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching on them is “Again, three, three. ”

original: slar yang gi sgras 'dab ma brgyad kyi rtsa ste des de ltar yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos kyi bdag nyid kyis gsum gsum du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: slar yang gi sgras 'dab ma brgyad kyi rtsa ste des de ltar yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi chos kyi bdag nyid kyis gsum gsum du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Again, the channels of the eight petals, thus again, by the nature of the phenomena of body, speech, and mind, there are three, three.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi de rnams sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo la gnas ma rnams kyi rdo rje'i rlung shin tu phra ba'i gzugs kyis rnam par gnas pa 'di ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi de rnams sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo la gnas ma rnams kyi rdo rje'i rlung shin tu phra ba'i gzugs kyis rnam par gnas pa 'di ni nges pa'o //
translated: These twenty-four are the channels located on the body, speech, and mind cakras in the form of very subtle vajra winds. This is certain.

original: slar yang lte ba'i 'khor lor rtsa'i padma 'dab ma bcu gnyis rnams su mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang lte ba'i 'khor lor rtsa'i padma 'dab ma bcu gnyis rnams su mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: Again, in the navel cakra, the twelve-petaled lotus of the nāḍīs, the dakini and so on are situated.

original: gnas de rnams su rdo rje rlung gi rnam par cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas de rnams su rdo rje rlung gi rnam par cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the form of the vajra wind in those places?

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste re re'i nang rnams su rta rna ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i gzugs kyi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste re re'i nang rnams su rta rna ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i gzugs kyi gnas pa'o //
translated: “At that time,” in each of the inner ones, the form of the wheel of the maṇḍala, such as Hayakarṇī, and so on, is situated.

original: 'o na rdo rje'i rlung ni rnam pa med pa'i gzugs su gyur pa yin pa rnal 'byor ma ni rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / na yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na rdo rje'i rlung ni rnam pa med pa'i gzugs su gyur pa yin pa rnal 'byor ma ni rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no zhe na / gsungs pa / na yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the vajra wind is formless, and the yoginī is endowed with form.🔽It is said:

original: na'i yi ge'i don gyi lha mo de yang gsal pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: na'i yi ge'i don gyi lha mo de yang gsal pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The goddess of the meaning of the letter na is also not clear.”

original: rnam pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: She is not endowed with form.

original: de ji ltar mi gsal zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi gsal zhe na /
translated: How is she not clear?

original: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste rags pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste rags pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “By nature,” that is, by a coarse form.

original: sems de nyid rags pa'i rnam pas mi gsal ba'i gzugs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: sems de nyid rags pa'i rnam pas mi gsal ba'i gzugs su 'gro ste /
translated: That very mind goes to the form of the subtle, due to the gross aspect.

original: de de ltar @242a * //
analyzed: de de ltar @242a * //
translated: Thus,

original: gsal ba rab kyi mthar phyin pas rdo rje'i rlung ste rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rab kyi mthar phyin pas rdo rje'i rlung ste rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is the vajra wind, because of the equality of the vajra.

original: sems ni lus kyi nang thams cad du dbang po la sogs pa thams cad dang khams kyi gzugs can te des rnam pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: sems ni lus kyi nang thams cad du dbang po la sogs pa thams cad dang khams kyi gzugs can te des rnam pa med par bshad do //
translated: The mind is the form of the body, which is all the sense organs and so on, and the form of the elements.

original: yang gi yi ge ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi yi ge ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word “also” is inclusive.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the nature of the nonduality of clarity and nonclarity is the form of the yoginī.

original: des kyang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi yang dag ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi byang chub kyi yan lag la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i rang lus dang sems bsgrub pa rdzogs pa de'i tshe kanytsi'i yi ge gnyis kyis gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa byed pa'i
analyzed: des kyang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi yang dag ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi byang chub kyi yan lag la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i rang lus dang sems bsgrub pa rdzogs pa de'i tshe kanytsi'i yi ge gnyis kyis gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa byed pa'i
translated: Also, when the yogin, who is abiding in the branch of enlightenment of the true samādhi of the nature of the yoginīs, has accomplished his own body and mind, at that time, the two syllables kṣa and ṇḍa are the accomplishment of others.

original: rgyur 'dod pa'i khams su bskyed pa ste zhes bya bar bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyur 'dod pa'i khams su bskyed pa ste zhes bya bar bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The arising in the desire realm is generated by the cause that is asserted.🔽Thus, it is said:

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: desire and so on.

original: der byung ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: der byung ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: The arising there is by the reasoning explained previously.

original: de'i tshe thar pa'i gzugs can gyi las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe thar pa'i gzugs can gyi las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: At that time, the karma of the form of liberation

original: las dang yongs su ldan pas las can te bshad par 'gyur ba'i brnyas pa byed pa de rnams kyi gsad pa la sogs pa'i las bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang yongs su ldan pas las can te bshad par 'gyur ba'i brnyas pa byed pa de rnams kyi gsad pa la sogs pa'i las bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: is the agent endowed with karma, and in order to accomplish the karma of killing and so on of those who are despised, as will be explained,

original: rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs su 'dod pa'i khams su sems bskyed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs su 'dod pa'i khams su sems bskyed do //
translated: the mind is generated in the desire realm in the form of a yoginī.

original: gang gi las kyis skye 'gro thams cad thar pa'i gzugs can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi las kyis skye 'gro thams cad thar pa'i gzugs can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By whose karma will all migrating beings become the form of liberation?🔽By what dharma will that be?

original: de chos gang gis 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de chos gang gis 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: tsya yig 'pho ba yi ni chos //
analyzed: tsya yig 'pho ba yi ni chos //
translated: The dharma of the transference of the syllable cy.

original: zhes bya ba ste shin tu sdang ba'i sems can gzhan rnam par 'joms par byed pa rnams mnar med pa la sogs par 'tshed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste shin tu sdang ba'i sems can gzhan rnam par 'joms par byed pa rnams mnar med pa la sogs par 'tshed do //
translated: Extremely hateful sentient beings who destroy others are boiled in Avīci and so on.

original: de ltar mnar med la sogs par rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis tshes yid la byas nas bdag der 'tshed par byed pa mchog yin gyi de rnams kyi grol ba thob par bya ba'i phyir gsad pa la sogs pa byas nas ji srid du sdang ba'i las rnams la
analyzed: de ltar mnar med la sogs par rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis tshes yid la byas nas bdag der 'tshed par byed pa mchog yin gyi de rnams kyi grol ba thob par bya ba'i phyir gsad pa la sogs pa byas nas ji srid du sdang ba'i las rnams la
translated: Thus, the yogis and yoginis, having brought to mind the Avīci hell, etc., think, “It is best that I be boiled there. Having killed them, etc., for the sake of their attaining liberation, for as long as they are averse to the actions of

original: dga' ba dang bral bar byed pa de srid du thams cad sems kyi nang du grol ba ste gnyis ka grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bral bar byed pa de srid du thams cad sems kyi nang du grol ba ste gnyis ka grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: hatred, for that long they are liberated in their own minds. Both are liberated.

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi dgos pa byed pa rnams kyi bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med pa'i sems de'i nang du grol ba @242b zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi dgos pa byed pa rnams kyi bdag dang bdag gi ba'i 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med pa'i sems de'i nang du grol ba @242b zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is it that the bodhisattvas, who are engaged in the welfare of others, are liberated in their own minds, by being free from the instincts of desire and aversion, and by being free from the grasping of “I” and “mine”?

original: sdang ba rnams kyi skyon spangs pas rang gi sems kyi nang du de ltar grol ba'o //
analyzed: sdang ba rnams kyi skyon spangs pas rang gi sems kyi nang du de ltar grol ba'o //
translated: They are liberated in their own minds, by abandoning the faults of those who are averse.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And also:

original: sems ni skyon rnams su 'pho 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni skyon rnams su 'pho 'gyur //
translated: The mind is transformed into faults.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pas skyon med de //🔽rkang pa lag pa la sogs pas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pas skyon med de // rkang pa lag pa la sogs pas //
translated: There is no fault in the intention of others.🔽Even if one strikes others with one's feet, hands, and so on,

original: gzhan la brgyab kyang skyon med do //🔽de ni lus la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan la brgyab kyang skyon med do // de ni lus la sogs pa yi //
translated: there is no fault.🔽This is because it is merely the form of the body, and so on,

original: rnam pa tsam du gnas pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa tsam du gnas pas so //
translated: that remains.

original: bag chags bcas byung skyon rnams kyis //
analyzed: bag chags bcas byung skyon rnams kyis //
translated: The fetters of the faults that arise with traces

original: 'ching ba rnams kyis 'pho ba'o //🔽grangs med pa yi gzugs can gyi //
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams kyis 'pho ba'o // grangs med pa yi gzugs can gyi //
translated: are transferred.🔽The conduct of the mind with a form

original: sems kyi spyod pa gzung bar bya //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa gzung bar bya //
translated: that is beyond number should be grasped.

original: sems grol ba yi thams cad ni //
analyzed: sems grol ba yi thams cad ni //
translated: When the mind is liberated, everything

original: der ni thams cad grol bar 'gyur //🔽phyin ci log dga' sdang bdag can //
analyzed: der ni thams cad grol bar 'gyur // phyin ci log dga' sdang bdag can //
translated: is liberated there.🔽The mind that has the nature of attraction and aversion

original: gzhan la brnyas pa yi ni sems //
analyzed: gzhan la brnyas pa yi ni sems //
translated: to others and that despises others

original: bsod nams skrun phyir rnal 'byor pas //🔽'di yi phan yon 'dir ci zad //
analyzed: bsod nams skrun phyir rnal 'byor pas // 'di yi phan yon 'dir ci zad //
translated: is the cause of the destruction of merit.🔽What is the benefit of this here?

original: 'di dang gang du gsad par bya //
analyzed: 'di dang gang du gsad par bya //
translated: Where is this to be killed?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngon du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas na de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis ston te /
