analyzed: sngags kyi sgras byang chub kyi sems kyis 'ong ba ste /
translated: The term “mantra” refers to the bodhicitta.

original: der skyes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba de mtshon byar bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba de mtshon byar bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: The connate joy that arises there is the object to be illustrated.

original: de ltar mtshon byar gang mtshon par //
analyzed: de ltar mtshon byar gang mtshon par //
translated: “In that way, whatever is illustrated

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i de mtshon par bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i de mtshon par bya ba ste /
translated: This is the indication of the supreme nondual state.

original: ji srid de mtshon pa can du 'gyur ba ste mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i gzugs sems kyi khams nang du nub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid de mtshon pa can du 'gyur ba ste mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i gzugs sems kyi khams nang du nub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As long as there is an indication, there is the supreme nondual form, which is the meaning of “the inner dissolution of the mind element.”

original: gang du nub par 'gyur @255a * //
analyzed: gang du nub par 'gyur @255a * //
translated: Where does it dissolve?

original: ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: ba gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the lotus, etc.

original: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis te pad snal lta bu'i skud pa zhes bya ba rkang pa'i mtha' nas mgo bor gang zhig rgyud de'i dbus su mda'i shugs kyis de'i mtha'i bzhir rnal 'byor ba'i sems mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can du phyin nas so //
analyzed: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis te pad snal lta bu'i skud pa zhes bya ba rkang pa'i mtha' nas mgo bor gang zhig rgyud de'i dbus su mda'i shugs kyis de'i mtha'i bzhir rnal 'byor ba'i sems mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can du phyin nas so //
translated: The meaning of the syllable va is “thread,” like the thread of a lotus. From the end of the foot to the head, that which is threaded in the middle of the body, by the force of the arrow, the yogin’s mind goes to the end of that, in the nature of the supreme nondual state.

original: de yi dus su mthong ba min //
analyzed: de yi dus su mthong ba min //
translated: At that time, it is not seen, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the abiding.

original: srog chags zhes bya ba ni srog dang yang dag par ldan pa ste srog chags ni rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya ba ni srog dang yang dag par ldan pa ste srog chags ni rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The living being is one who is endowed with life, and the living being is the nature of one's own mind.

original: phyi rol du yang 'di bsam pa tsam gyis 'gyur ba ste 'di la the tshom med de mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang 'di bsam pa tsam gyis 'gyur ba ste 'di la the tshom med de mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Even externally, this is just an idea, and there is no doubt about this, so one should not say it is not so.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meditation on the wheel of the maṇḍala is stated:

original: bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs sla'o //
translated: Meditate and so forth up to should be accomplished is easily understood.

original: da ni srin po'i rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni srin po'i rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the machine of the form of the rākṣasa is stated:

original: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The machine and so forth.

original: sngon gyi zhes bya ba ni dum bu bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid de la bri bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi zhes bya ba ni dum bu bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid de la bri bar bya ba ste /
translated: The former is the one consisting of forty-nine parts, and it should be drawn on that.

original: ji lta'i cho gas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta'i cho gas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By what rite?

original: de ltar thog ma zhes bya ba ni dum bu thog mar te /
analyzed: de ltar thog ma zhes bya ba ni dum bu thog mar te /
translated: Thus, the first is the first part,

original: de rnam par snang mdzad ni yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: de rnam par snang mdzad ni yi ge aom mo //
translated: and in that, Vairocana is the syllable oṃ.

original: pa ya dag ces bya ba ni yi ge ba dang yi ge ya dag go //
analyzed: pa ya dag ces bya ba ni yi ge ba dang yi ge ya dag go //
translated: The two are the letters va and ya.

original: ka ra ka ra la sogs pa //
analyzed: ka ra ka ra la sogs pa //
translated: Kara kara and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i ka ra ka ra la sogs pa'i phreng ba'i sngags kyi nang du bcug pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i ka ra ka ra la sogs pa'i phreng ba'i sngags kyi nang du bcug pas so //
translated: This is because the mantra garland of the Blessed One Śrī Heruka, beginning with kara kara, is inserted.

original: de ltar lkugs par bcing ba zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kyang 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar lkugs par bcing ba zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas kyang 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: Thus, binding the mute is the concise cakra of the machine by the previously explained reasoning.

original: nyung ngu bsdus par shes par byas nas de thams cad phyi rol du byi ba'i steng gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ste /
analyzed: nyung ngu bsdus par shes par byas nas de thams cad phyi rol du byi ba'i steng gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ste /
translated: Having understood the concise summary, all of that is done externally, on the back of a rat and so forth.

original: ba lang gi rmig pa zhes bya ba ni ba lang shi ba'i rmig par ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi rmig pa zhes bya ba ni ba lang shi ba'i rmig par ro //
translated: The cow's hoof is in the hoof of a dead cow.

original: de ltar slar yang nang gi bdag nyid du bdag nyid kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du byas nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang nang gi bdag nyid du bdag nyid kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du byas nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, again, having made it into one's own inner nature within the avadhūtī of oneself, and so forth.

original: srog 'chad pa thams cad kyi yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dus su dbu mar rnam par thim par bya ba'o//
analyzed: srog 'chad pa thams cad kyi yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dus su dbu mar rnam par thim par bya ba'o//
translated: All the life-breaths are to be dissolved into the central channel at the time of the mandala of pristine awareness by means of the yantras of the letters.

original: @255b srin po zhes bya ba ni byi la'am rnga mo'o //
analyzed: @255b srin po zhes bya ba ni byi la'am rnga mo'o //
translated: The rākṣasa is the cat or the camel.

original: yang na mngon sum du srin po zhes bya ba nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: yang na mngon sum du srin po zhes bya ba nye bar spyod do //
translated: Or else, one should practice the so-called rākṣasa in actuality.

original: slar yang ma bshad kyang 'dir dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: slar yang ma bshad kyang 'dir dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
translated: Although not explained again here, the definition of the mindfulness factor of awakening is explained.

original: gang gi tshe sngon du bshad pa'i man ngag gi cho gas ro nyid du gnas pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i chos dag tu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon du bshad pa'i man ngag gi cho gas ro nyid du gnas pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i chos dag tu'o //
translated: When, by the method of the previously explained instructions, the phenomena of pristine awareness and consciousness abide as the corpse,

original: de bzhin du yang chos thams cad lhag par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang chos thams cad lhag par rtog par byed do //
translated: one should also imagine all phenomena in that way.

original: de rab tu zhugs pas so //
analyzed: de rab tu zhugs pas so //
translated: By engaging in that,

original: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin yang dag par brjod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: one should utter the sound of its nature, which is called the “utterance of the sound of the nature of reality.”

original: yang dag pa'i skyabs kyi dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyabs kyi dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The mindfulness factor of awakening is the true refuge.

original: logs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bzhin zhes bya ba'i don nam /
analyzed: logs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bzhin zhes bya ba'i don nam /
translated: Or, it is the meaning of “like the saṃbhogakāya for others.”

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the direct perception of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated:

original: ye shes lkugs pa bzhin du gnas //
analyzed: ye shes lkugs pa bzhin du gnas //
translated: Wisdom abides like a mute.

original: rnam shes nyid kyang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rnam shes nyid kyang de dang 'dra //
translated: Consciousness itself is also like that.

original: chos kun gnas la phyin nas ni //
analyzed: chos kun gnas la phyin nas ni //
translated: Having arrived at the abode of all phenomena,

original: dran byang yan lag sku gsum skyes //
analyzed: dran byang yan lag sku gsum skyes //
translated: the three kāyas arise from the branches of mindfulness.

original: dran byang yan lag lam 'gro ba //
analyzed: dran byang yan lag lam 'gro ba //
translated: The path of the branches of mindfulness

original: rjes su brjod med chos su 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes su brjod med chos su 'gyur //
translated: becomes the inexpressible Dharma.

original: ji ltar rmi lam du mthong ba //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam du mthong ba //
translated: Just as what is seen in a dream

original: sad pa na yang thob pa med //
analyzed: sad pa na yang thob pa med //
translated: is not obtained upon awakening,

original: gnyid log sad pa nyid dag tu //
analyzed: gnyid log sad pa nyid dag tu //
translated: in the state of sleep and upon awakening,

original: mtshon te gang zhig mtshon pa med //
analyzed: mtshon te gang zhig mtshon pa med //
translated: there is nothing to illustrate or that is illustrated.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de 'drar 'gro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de 'drar 'gro //
translated: The buddhas are like that.

original: lkugs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: lkugs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin can //
translated: They have the nature of a mute.

original: zhes so // gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The other [lines] are easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang de ltar thams cad kyang rdo rje phag mo'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo brgyad par mdor bstan nas zhes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar thams cad kyang rdo rje phag mo'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo brgyad par mdor bstan nas zhes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is certain.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las //
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las //
translated: In the commentary on the great yoga tantra king of the glorious Dakini Ocean, the Ship,

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor bas lkugs par bya ba dang sna tshogs pa'i man ngag gi rab tu sbyor ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang srin po'i rnam par 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor bas lkugs par bya ba dang sna tshogs pa'i man ngag gi rab tu sbyor ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang srin po'i rnam par 'khrul 'khor gyi cho ga rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: the method of rendering mute by the application of the letters of the name of Cakravarmi, and the characteristics of the method of application of the various esoteric instructions, and likewise the meditation on the mandala circle, and the method of the extensive teaching of the yantra of the rakshasa,

original: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'i bshad pa'o /🔽// / zhi ba'i rnam pa'i gzugs can ma'i //
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'i bshad pa'o / // / zhi ba'i rnam pa'i gzugs can ma'i //
translated: is the explanation of the forty-fifth chapter.

original: shin dpa' rnal 'byor ma la 'dud //
analyzed: shin dpa' rnal 'byor ma la 'dud //
translated: I bow to the hero Yoginī,

original: sangs rgyas nyid ster ba'i lha mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ster ba'i lha mo //
translated: the goddess who grants buddhahood.

original: sems @256a * //
analyzed: sems @256a * //
translated: The mind is not a thing.

original: can thams cad dngos po ma //
analyzed: can thams cad dngos po ma //
translated: All sentient beings are not things.

original: de las mchog gyur srid gsum med //
analyzed: de las mchog gyur srid gsum med //
translated: There is nothing superior to that in the three worlds.

original: rang bdag gis las rtogs byed ma'i //🔽tshig rnams ji lta'i don gyis ni //
analyzed: rang bdag gis las rtogs byed ma'i // tshig rnams ji lta'i don gyis ni //
translated: The words that cause one to understand one’s own nature🔽are explained correctly in the commentary

original: de yi 'grel pa yang dag bshad //
analyzed: de yi 'grel pa yang dag bshad //
translated: according to the meaning of the words.

original: da ni shin tu dpa' mo'i zhi ba bsgrub pa'i le'u be zhi bcu rtsa drug pa rgya cher bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni shin tu dpa' mo'i zhi ba bsgrub pa'i le'u be zhi bcu rtsa drug pa rgya cher bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, chapter 66 will explain in detail the accomplishment of the peace of the very heroic lady.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: de nas shin tu dpa' mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas shin tu dpa' mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the very heroic lady, and so on.🔽The illumination of the rite of peace is the application of the syllables of the names of the very heroic lady, and so on, which will be explained.

original: zhi ba'i las kyi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i shin tu dpa' mo la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba de rnams su bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to ;
analyzed: zhi ba'i las kyi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i shin tu dpa' mo la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba de rnams su bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to ;
translated: One should explain them.

original: / de rnams kyis shin tu dpa' mo'i yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba bya'o //🔽n'a ga ra ra yongs su gnas //
analyzed: / de rnams kyis shin tu dpa' mo'i yi ge'i rab tu sbyor ba bya'o // n'a ga ra ra yongs su gnas //
translated: The application of the syllables of the very heroic lady is with those.

original: zhes bya ba ni n'a ga ra'i yi ge la gnas pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni n'a ga ra'i yi ge la gnas pas so //
translated: The abode of the nāgarā is the abode of the syllable nāgarā.

original: de bzhin du de'i nye bar spyod par btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i nye bar spyod par btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should do so with the equanimity limb of enlightenment, which is his enjoyment.

original: lha yi 'khor lo stobs chen zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lha'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: lha yi 'khor lo stobs chen zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lha'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The “divine wheel of great power” is the divine wheel that will be explained.

original: 'dir lha'i sgra ni mtshams sbyor gyi skad kyis sha ba la 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir lha'i sgra ni mtshams sbyor gyi skad kyis sha ba la 'chad do //
translated: Here, the word “divine” is explained by the word “deer” in the compound.

original: des zhi ba ste zhi ba'i gzugs nyid pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: des zhi ba ste zhi ba'i gzugs nyid pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it with that, with the form of peace, with the nature of peace.

original: de ltar gang du bsgrub par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gang du bsgrub par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, he has stated where it is to be accomplished.

original: dpral ba'i gnas su ste dpral ba'i dbus kyi lte bar lha mo shin tu dpa' mo 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpral ba'i gnas su ste dpral ba'i dbus kyi lte bar lha mo shin tu dpa' mo 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the place of the forehead, in the center of the forehead, one should meditate on the goddess, the very heroic one, in the form of the wheel of the maṇḍala that will be explained.

original: rjes su gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the consecration.

original: de rnams skye 'gro'i bdag po ste slar yang yi ge rnams kyi don gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams skye 'gro'i bdag po ste slar yang yi ge rnams kyi don gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Those are the lords of living beings, and again, he states the meaning of the syllables.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Bliss” and so on.

original: su'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: su'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: Whose meaning of the syllables?

original: bde bas gang ba'i rtsa chen zhes bya ba ni dbu mas byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig pa'i bde bas gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bas gang ba'i rtsa chen zhes bya ba ni dbu mas byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig pa'i bde bas gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great channel called “filled with bliss” is filled with the bliss together with the bodhicitta by means of the central channel.

original: dbang po gnyis ni 'dus pa las //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis ni 'dus pa las //
translated: From the union of the two organs

original: zhes bya ba ni 'og dang steng yongs su bsdus pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'og dang steng yongs su bsdus pas so //
translated: means from the union of the lower and upper.

original: yang na phyi rol gyi yan lag can ma dang rgyun mi 'chad par goms pa'i 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: yang na phyi rol gyi yan lag can ma dang rgyun mi 'chad par goms pa'i 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: Or else, from the union of the external possessor of parts and the internal possessor of parts, by the practice of non-emission through uninterrupted practice.

original: g-yo ba med pas 'dir sa bon //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pas 'dir sa bon // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The seed is unmoving here.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma gnyis kyi dbus su sems kyi sa bon mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma gnyis kyi dbus su sems kyi sa bon mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: Here means in the middle of the vajra and lotus, the seed of mind is unmoving.

original: hi'i yi ge ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: hi'i yi ge ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The syllable hi has the meaning of “because. ”

original: @256b bcu gnyis mtha' ru mi bskyod pas //
analyzed: @256b bcu gnyis mtha' ru mi bskyod pas //
translated: The Akṣobhya at the end of the twelfth

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: means

original: dpral ba'i lte ba'i dbus su thig le bzung ba'i phyir 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor bas thig le gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpral ba'i lte ba'i dbus su thig le bzung ba'i phyir 'pho ba med pa'i sbyor bas thig le gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that the two bindus are held in the middle of the uvula by the practice of non-emission, because the bindu is held in the middle of the forehead.

original: 'dis bral zhes bya ba la sogs pas bi'i yi ge'i don gyis yang 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis bral zhes bya ba la sogs pas bi'i yi ge'i don gyis yang 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse beginning with freed from this, etc. Freed from this means freed from attachment, i.e., non-dual wisdom.🔽Who attains it?

original: sus 'thob pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sus 'thob pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: by the sense faculties, etc.

original: khams dang phung po dang skye mched dang yul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: khams dang phung po dang skye mched dang yul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: Attachment is to the elements, aggregates, sense bases, objects, etc.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one attains nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de ltar mnyam pa'i bde ba rnal 'byor chen pos 'grub kyis gzhan gyis ma yin zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa'i bde ba rnal 'byor chen pos 'grub kyis gzhan gyis ma yin zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the great yogi accomplishes the bliss of equality, not others. This is the meaning of the verse beginning with thus, etc.

original: 'di byas pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor bar dogs pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di byas pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor bar dogs pa cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: What is the fear of samsara for yogis who do this? It is said:

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: attachment, etc., by the meaning of the letter ra.

original: skyes bu gnyis med ces bya ba ni chen po'i don gyis pha rol mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang mun pa dang / dri ma la sogs pa'i rnyog pa rnams dang bral ba rnal 'byor pas 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyis med ces bya ba ni chen po'i don gyis pha rol mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang mun pa dang / dri ma la sogs pa'i rnyog pa rnams dang bral ba rnal 'byor pas 'thob pa'o //
translated: The “non-dual person” is the meaning of “great,” which is the transcendence of suffering, free from the impurities of passion, hatred, and darkness, and so on, attained by the yogi.

original: dga' bas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden par spro bas rtse bar gyur pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: dga' bas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden par spro bas rtse bar gyur pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: “ Joy” is the conventional truth, and “play” is the delight in it. That is explained in that way.

original: skyes bu'i sgra yang 'od gsal ba ste dga' ba yang rang bzhin gyi chos de gnyis su med pa'i dngos pos mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i sgra yang 'od gsal ba ste dga' ba yang rang bzhin gyi chos de gnyis su med pa'i dngos pos mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: The word “person” is clear light, and “joy” is the nature of reality. By the non-dual entity of those two, the meaning of the intention is “supreme non-duality.”

original: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams thams cad kyi chos ci la las yang de dag tu bltas par gyur pas rnam par bral bar 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams thams cad kyi chos ci la las yang de dag tu bltas par gyur pas rnam par bral bar 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the statement that all those dharmas of passion, and so on, are seen as those, and so are separated, is stated:

original: med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste na'i yi ge'i don gyis te de nyid de rnams kyi thog mar na'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste na'i yi ge'i don gyis te de nyid de rnams kyi thog mar na'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: The meaning of the syllable na is not, etc.

original: theg pa gsum las gzhan med do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum las gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other than the three vehicles.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po dang bral ba'i gzhan mu stegs can gyi chos la lta ba rnams kyis dus thams cad du 'dod chags la sogs pas nyams par byed do //🔽de'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi chos la lta bar gyur pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du thos pa dang bsam pa la @257a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po dang bral ba'i gzhan mu stegs can gyi chos la lta ba rnams kyis dus thams cad du 'dod chags la sogs pas nyams par byed do // de'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi chos la lta bar gyur pa rnams kyis dus thams cad du thos pa dang bsam pa la @257a * //
translated: This means that those who are outside the three vehicles of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Mahayana, who are outside the Dharma of the three vehicles, who are outside the views of the tirthikas, are always defiled by attachment, etc.

original: sogs pa'i las kyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: sogs pa'i las kyis ston par byed de /
translated: Therefore, those who have the views of the Dharma of the three vehicles always teach through the activities of listening, reflection, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon kyang don dam pa lhag par rtogs pas kyang de'i gzugs nyid pas theg pa gsum la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon kyang don dam pa lhag par rtogs pas kyang de'i gzugs nyid pas theg pa gsum la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad bya'o //
translated: And the faults of attachment, etc. are also the form of that, because of the realization of the ultimate. Therefore, all the branches of the three vehicles, etc. should be practiced.

original: don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yang gsungs pa /
translated: The branches of the ultimate's own characteristic are also taught:

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ga'i yi ge'i don gyis te 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa gnas dang gnas su 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed do /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ga'i yi ge'i don gyis te 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa gnas dang gnas su 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed do /
translated: The meaning of the syllables ga and so forth is as follows: Going means that the yogi goes to and fro from place to place.

original: de yang don dam pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de yang don dam pa'i gzugs so //
translated: And that is the ultimate form.

original: gnyid log ces bya ba ni gnyid kyis rab tu bcings pa'i rmi lam na yang don dam pa sgom pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: gnyid log ces bya ba ni gnyid kyis rab tu bcings pa'i rmi lam na yang don dam pa sgom pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: Sleeping means that even in dreams, bound by sleep, one does not abandon the cultivation of the ultimate.

original: de ltar bza' ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed pa na mi 'dor ba ste des mang po'i tshig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bza' ba la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed pa na mi 'dor ba ste des mang po'i tshig tu byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, when performing all actions such as eating and so forth, one does not abandon it. That is the plural particle.

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor sgrub pas spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gcig tu rnal 'byor sgrub ba tsam bsgrub par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor sgrub pas spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gcig tu rnal 'byor sgrub ba tsam bsgrub par mi bya ste /
translated: However, the yogi should practice means that one should not practice only the yoga of accomplishment.

original: theg pa gsum la sogs pa thams cad yan lag gang gsungs pa de thams cad bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la sogs pa thams cad yan lag gang gsungs pa de thams cad bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that one should do all that is taught in the three vehicles and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor pa la gnyis kas kyang mi gos pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la gnyis kas kyang mi gos pa de gsungs pa /
translated: That the yogi is not sullied by either is stated:

original: dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Joy and so forth.

original: ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: By the meaning of the syllable ra.

original: mi gos zhes bya ba ni dga' rtse la sogs pa'i skyon rnams kyis dri ma can du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gos zhes bya ba ni dga' rtse la sogs pa'i skyon rnams kyis dri ma can du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not soiled means that the faults of passion, play, etc. do not make it dirty.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la chu bzhin no //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la chu bzhin no //
translated: Like a lotus leaf by water.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Therefore and so forth explains that in the same way.

original: don yod mthong bas zhes bya ba ni don yod pa ste 'bras bu dang bcas ba dngos grub dang mya ngan las 'das pa de mthong bas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yod mthong bas zhes bya ba ni don yod pa ste 'bras bu dang bcas ba dngos grub dang mya ngan las 'das pa de mthong bas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeing the meaningful means that the meaningful, that is, the accomplishment with result, and nirvana, by seeing that, the sufferings of cyclic existence will be pacified.

original: sna tshogs pa'i dmyal ba dang phag la sogs pa'i skye gnas kyi nang du mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i dmyal ba dang phag la sogs pa'i skye gnas kyi nang du mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not enter into the various hells and the wombs of pigs, etc.

original: gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Whatever and so forth is easy to understand.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meditation of the mandala circle is stated:

original: rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The assembly of yoginis and so forth.

original: thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Everything is easy to understand.

original: da ni 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bzhi pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bzhi pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, (the Bhagavān) declares the meaning of the fourth wheel of the yantra:

original: bzhi bcu rtsa dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The forty-nine and so forth.

original: de ltar dbus kyi phyi rol gyi dum bu bzhi la rnam par @257b snang mdzad kyi sa bon bzhi zhes bya ba ni aom gyi yi ge bzhi phyogs rnams su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbus kyi phyi rol gyi dum bu bzhi la rnam par @257b snang mdzad kyi sa bon bzhi zhes bya ba ni aom gyi yi ge bzhi phyogs rnams su bri bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the four outer sectors of the center, the four seed syllables of Vairocana, that is, the four letters OM, should be written in the directions.

original: der grva rnams su yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: der grva rnams su yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: There, in the corners, are the letters HŪṀ.

original: lhag ma rnams su ji lta ba bzhin bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams su ji lta ba bzhin bri bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be written as they are.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo rnams sam sna tshogs pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo rnams sam sna tshogs pa'i las rnams so //
translated: All means all the yantras, mantras, and cakras, or the various actions.

original: kun tu spyod pa shes par bya //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa shes par bya //
translated: One should know the conduct.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim pa ste rtsa'i kun du spyod pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i dbugs kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i brtan pa'i sbyor bas 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim pa ste rtsa'i kun du spyod pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i dbugs kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i brtan pa'i sbyor bas 'grub pa'o //
translated: This is the previously explained process, which is accomplished by the practice of stability, indicated by the left and right nostril breaths, the conduct of the nāḍīs.

original: de'i phyir thig le'i sgra'i dus su zhes bya ba ni aa wa dh'u t'ir dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa de'i nang du rab tu zhugs pa ste byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le'i sgra'i dus su zhes bya ba ni aa wa dh'u t'ir dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa de'i nang du rab tu zhugs pa ste byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'gro ba'o //
translated: Therefore, “at the time of the sound of the drop” is the entry into the mandala of the avadhūtī, the going of the drop of bodhicitta into it.

original: de slar yang de'i nang du thim nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de slar yang de'i nang du thim nas 'gro'o //
translated: Again, it dissolves into it and goes.

original: des sgra las 'byung ba ste bde ba chen po'i rnam pa spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes de'i dus su /
analyzed: des sgra las 'byung ba ste bde ba chen po'i rnam pa spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes de'i dus su /
translated: By that, “from the sound” is the arising of the gnosis of the nature of non-elaborated great bliss.

original: rlung gi gnas lugs brtan pas zhes bya ba ni srog 'gro ba dang 'ong ba spangs pa gang gi tshe de'i tshe las thams cad bya ba ste /
analyzed: rlung gi gnas lugs brtan pas zhes bya ba ni srog 'gro ba dang 'ong ba spangs pa gang gi tshe de'i tshe las thams cad bya ba ste /
translated: “By the stability of the abiding of the wind” is when the life-force is abandoned from going and coming, at that time all actions are performed.

original: ye shes las byung bas so //
analyzed: ye shes las byung bas so //
translated: Because it arises from gnosis,

original: zhi ba'i gzugs nyid pas 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gzugs nyid pas 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: by the nature of the peaceful form, it enters into nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad de lhag ma thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad de lhag ma thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Therefore, “the buddhas” and so on explain that just so, and all the rest is easy to understand.

original: de ltar yang thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i dgu pa'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang thams cad rdo rje phag mo'i dgu pa'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the wheel of the nine [goddesses] of Vajravarahi, the mantra, and the wheel are like that.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las shin tu dpa' mo'i rnal 'byor ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pas de'i bskyed pa dang phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las shin tu dpa' mo'i rnal 'byor ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pas de'i bskyed pa dang phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi zhi ba'i las kyi sbyor ba
translated: In the commentary on the great king of tantras, the glorious Ocean of Dakas, the Ship, the yoga of Prachandali, the generation of her with the syllables of her name, and so on, the performance of the pacifying activity that has the nature of the outer and inner,

original: sgrub pa'i rab tu sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang 'khrul 'khor gyi gnod mdzes rgyal po'i dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags rnams su lha'i gdong zhes bya bas bsgrubs par bya ba dang sgrub pa po rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam par
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rab tu sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang 'khrul 'khor gyi gnod mdzes rgyal po'i dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags rnams su lha'i gdong zhes bya bas bsgrubs par bya ba dang sgrub pa po rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam par
translated: the performance of the practice, the meditation of the mandala circle, the wheel of the wrathful king, and the mantras of the wrathful king, with the words “face of the deity,” are accomplished.

original: gzhag pa'i dgongs pa'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa zhes bya ba ste le'u bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: gzhag pa'i dgongs pa'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa zhes bya ba ste le'u bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the forty-sixth chapter of the tantra, called “The Extensive Teaching of the Characteristics of the Ritual of the Intention of Placement.”

original: // / @258a * //  srung ba'i don kun mdzad pa mo //
analyzed: // / @258a * //  srung ba'i don kun mdzad pa mo //
translated: Having bowed to the one who performs all the aims of protection,

original: stobs chen ma la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: stobs chen ma la phyag byas nas //
translated: the one of great power,

original: sna tshogs man ngag tu gnas ma //
analyzed: sna tshogs man ngag tu gnas ma //
translated: the one who abides in the various intimate instructions,

original: rnal 'byor ma stobs ming can ma //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma stobs ming can ma //
translated: the one named Yoginī-mahābalā,

original: ye shes rnam pas 'jig rten du //
analyzed: ye shes rnam pas 'jig rten du //
translated: the one who is the world’s wisdom variety,

original: de rnams de nyid kyis srung ba'i //🔽brtse bas bdag gis de'i 'grel pa //
analyzed: de rnams de nyid kyis srung ba'i // brtse bas bdag gis de'i 'grel pa //
translated: the one who protects those very ones🔽with love, I will explain

original: rab tu rtogs byed bshad par bya //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs byed bshad par bya //
translated: her commentary, which is to be understood.

original: da ni srung ba thams cad kyi las chen po la gnas pa'i stobs chen ma'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni srung ba thams cad kyi las chen po la gnas pa'i stobs chen ma'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of the forty-seventh chapter, which is the great power of the great deeds of all the protectors, is stated:

original: de nas lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the goddess, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rdo rje phag mos bcom ldan 'das la dris pa dang / de'i lan nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rdo rje phag mos bcom ldan 'das la dris pa dang / de'i lan nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The question of Vajravārāhī to the Bhagavān with one verse, and the answer to that, “Listen,” etc., is stated.

original: stobs chen ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stobs chen ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great power and so forth.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The half-verse teaches the summary.

original: de'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of that is stated:

original: ma mo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma mo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the wheel of the mothers and so forth.

original: thog ma nyid du stobs chen ma'i yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du stobs chen ma'i yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
translated: First, the syllables of the great power are stated:

original: de'i ma'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: de'i ma'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: by the meaning of the syllables of the mother.

original: ma mo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni le'u bco lnga pa ji lta ba'am /
analyzed: ma mo'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni le'u bco lnga pa ji lta ba'am /
translated: The wheel of the mothers is as in the fifteenth chapter,

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bsgom pa'i dkyil 'khor du'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bsgom pa'i dkyil 'khor du'o //
translated: in the middle of the yoginī wheel, in the mandala of meditation that will be explained.

original: grong zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir te thar pa'i grong khyer nyams dga' ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: grong zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir te thar pa'i grong khyer nyams dga' ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The town is the place here, because of the delightful city of liberation.

original: dpa' bo'i gtso bo'i zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka de bsgom par bya ba ste rjes su gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i gtso bo'i zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka de bsgom par bya ba ste rjes su gnas par bya'o //
translated: The chief hero is the true samādhi, Śrī Heruka, that should be meditated upon, should be attended to.

original: gang de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub kyis rigs pas dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa'i dngos po gang phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can de'i gzugs kyis de'i bdag nyid can du mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: gang de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub kyis rigs pas dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa'i dngos po gang phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can de'i gzugs kyis de'i bdag nyid can du mtshon par bya ste /
translated: That is to be indicated by the form of that, i.e. by the form of the mandala and the mandala-deities, which are of the nature of the external and internal self, by the reasoning of the innate perfect enlightenment.

original: des de'i gzugs lha'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des de'i gzugs lha'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that, its form becomes the form of the deity.

original: 'di'i mngon sum du nyams su myong ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'di'i mngon sum du nyams su myong ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa //
translated: The direct experience of this is stated in the application:

original: ha'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: ha'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: By the meaning of the syllable ha.

original: h'a hi zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: h'a hi zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By ha hi and so forth.

original: drag shul sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams kyi mchog gi rnal 'byor rnams kyis sems rnam par bskyed pa'i drag shul gyi @258b sbyor ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: drag shul sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams kyi mchog gi rnal 'byor rnams kyis sems rnam par bskyed pa'i drag shul gyi @258b sbyor ba bya ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of the application of wrath is that the supreme yogis of these samadhis should perform the application of wrathful generation of the mind.

original: cis she na /
analyzed: cis she na /
translated: By what?

original: ha byin gyen son sngon du'o //
analyzed: ha byin gyen son sngon du'o //
translated: Ha is the upward flow of the gift.

original: zhes bya ba'i lce'i rtsa bar nang du 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lce'i rtsa bar nang du 'jug par bya ste /
translated: One should enter it inwardly at the root of the tongue.

original: h'a brjod pas so //
analyzed: h'a brjod pas so //
translated: By the utterance of ha.

original: des kyang bsil ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang bsil ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one becomes cool.

original: thur du sel ba bshad pa'i lam 'gog pa byas nas te /
analyzed: thur du sel ba bshad pa'i lam 'gog pa byas nas te /
translated: Having blocked the path of the downward-voiding wind,

original: tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: the syllable tu is the definite apprehension.

original: 'di byas pas /
analyzed: 'di byas pas /
translated: Having done this,

original: rnal 'byor thams cad yongs dmigs nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad yongs dmigs nas //
translated: all yogas are fully visualized.🔽This is the root of the trunk below the navel, the support of all of these yogas.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor 'di rnams thams cad kyi rten lus su lte ba'i 'og tu sdong po'i rtsa ba ste de'i sdong po las rtsa thams cad ces bya ba ni gtum mo rab tu spar bas aa wa dh'u t'i gzhon nu'i pad snal lta bu langs
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor 'di rnams thams cad kyi rten lus su lte ba'i 'og tu sdong po'i rtsa ba ste de'i sdong po las rtsa thams cad ces bya ba ni gtum mo rab tu spar bas aa wa dh'u t'i gzhon nu'i pad snal lta bu langs
translated: From that trunk, all channels are the flame of the fierce fire, which is the thread of the lotus of the avadhūtī, which is like the thread of a young girl.

original: pa ni thams cad stong pa zhes bya bar mngon par brjod do //🔽de'i phyir ba'i yi ge'i don gyis des spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni thams cad stong pa zhes bya bar mngon par brjod do // de'i phyir ba'i yi ge'i don gyis des spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The arising of that is expressed as “all empty.”

original: sdong po'i gnas nas spyi bo'i thod par spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gengs par byed de /
analyzed: sdong po'i gnas nas spyi bo'i thod par spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gengs par byed de /
translated: Therefore, by the meaning of the syllable bā, “conduct” and so on are filled by “conduct from the place of the trunk to the skull” and so on.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is explained.

original: ao rgyan zhes bya ba ni 'dir rtsa 'di rnams thams cad kyi re re'i bu ga gsum gyi bdag nyid can rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ao rgyan zhes bya ba ni 'dir rtsa 'di rnams thams cad kyi re re'i bu ga gsum gyi bdag nyid can rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: The Oḍḍiyāna is the three channels of all of these channels, each of which has three openings.

original: des kyang dbu ma'i las kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i zhes te /
analyzed: des kyang dbu ma'i las kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i zhes te /
translated: Also, the action of the central channel is the avadhūtī.

original: rtsa gsum po g-yon dang g-yas pa dang dbus so //🔽de'i g-yas pa'i rtsa ao rgyan gyi ming can te de'i bu gar 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid du gtum mo rab tu spar bas bu na gi rir zhu ba'i khams kyis thog ma'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems lta ba'i gnas
analyzed: rtsa gsum po g-yon dang g-yas pa dang dbus so // de'i g-yas pa'i rtsa ao rgyan gyi ming can te de'i bu gar 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid du gtum mo rab tu spar bas bu na gi rir zhu ba'i khams kyis thog ma'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems lta ba'i gnas
translated: The three channels are the left, right, and middle.

original: kyi rab tu 'ongs te /
analyzed: kyi rab tu 'ongs te /
translated: The right channel is named Oḍḍiyāna, and the opening there is the place of the view of the bodhicitta, which is the nature of the first joy, the element that melts in the body of Anāvṛta through the initial blazing of caṇḍālī.

original: der thob byas nas zhes bya ba brtan pa /
analyzed: der thob byas nas zhes bya ba brtan pa /
translated: Having reached there, it is stabilized.

original: des byang chub kyi sa bon can rnams kyis slar yang dbus ma'i bu ga dz'a la ndha ra ra bshad par steng du 'gro bar gyur pa rnams kyi gnyis pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin du spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des byang chub kyi sa bon can rnams kyis slar yang dbus ma'i bu ga dz'a la ndha ra ra bshad par steng du 'gro bar gyur pa rnams kyi gnyis pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin du spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is to say, those who have the seed of enlightenment again ascend through the central channel to the uvula, and those who go upward experience the second, which has the nature of supreme joy.

original: 'di'i de ltar slar yang l'a'i yi ge'i don gyis gnas skabs bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i de ltar slar yang l'a'i yi ge'i don gyis gnas skabs bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: Here, again, the meaning of the syllable LA is stated in terms of the four states.🔽The meaning of the syllable LA is stated in terms of the four states.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sign and so forth.

original: mtshan mar bzung ba gsung du ni //
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung ba gsung du ni //
translated: The sign is grasped in the speech.

original: zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i gnas la gang gi tshe sa'i rang bzhin steng du bgrod pa de'i tshe des gzung ba gsum gyis mgo bo la mtshan zhing brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i gnas la gang gi tshe sa'i rang bzhin steng du bgrod pa de'i tshe des gzung ba gsum gyis mgo bo la mtshan zhing brgyan pa ste /
translated: That is to say, when the nature of earth moves upward in the navel region, then by that, the head is marked and adorned with the three grasps.

original: de rnams kyi khams thams cad kyis lus thams cad du @259a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khams thams cad kyis lus thams cad du @259a * //
translated: By all of those, the entire body is

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gsum pas bkang ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gsum pas bkang ba'o //
translated: filled with the three that have the nature of innate joy.

original: slar yang lte ba'i gnas su rtsa thams cad kyi bu ga dang bu ga rnams su 'ongs ba ste des tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang lte ba'i gnas su rtsa thams cad kyi bu ga dang bu ga rnams su 'ongs ba ste des tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: By that, the letter “tu” is ascertained.🔽Therefore, the path of lalana is the fourth, explained as the joy of separation.

original: de'i phyir la la n'a'i lam ni bzhi pa bral ba'i dga' bar bshad pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyis phyi nas sngon gyi gnas su yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni dpral ba'i gnas su ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir la la n'a'i lam ni bzhi pa bral ba'i dga' bar bshad pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyis phyi nas sngon gyi gnas su yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni dpral ba'i gnas su ste /
translated: The special nature of passion is later, in the place of the forehead, called “the knowledge of former abodes.”

original: mchog tu zag pa med par mngon bar brjod par stobs chen ma'i byang chub chen po zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: mchog tu zag pa med par mngon bar brjod par stobs chen ma'i byang chub chen po zhes bya ba'o//
translated: It is called “the great enlightenment of the great powerful one” in the Supreme Uncontaminated Expression.

original: da ni sbyor ba 'di nyid kyi nye bar spyod pa sindhu'i yi ge gnyis kyis sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis yang dag pa'i lta ba'i lam gyis lta ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba 'di nyid kyi nye bar spyod pa sindhu'i yi ge gnyis kyis sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis yang dag pa'i lta ba'i lam gyis lta ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, by the two letters “sin” and “dhu” of this very application, the path of the right view is explained by the power of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: rtsa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the channel, etc.

original: si'i yi ge'i don gyis te rtsa'i sgras bye ba phrag phyed dang gsum gyi ye shes kyi rtsa rnams sngon du yang dag pa'i rig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: si'i yi ge'i don gyis te rtsa'i sgras bye ba phrag phyed dang gsum gyi ye shes kyi rtsa rnams sngon du yang dag pa'i rig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By the meaning of the syllable SI, that is, by the word “channel,” the channels of gnosis, which are 3.5 million, are filled with the element that is the melted elixir of gnosis, which is beyond the fourth [dhyāna] from the throat to the great compassion.

original: de ltar mes zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa nas snying rje chen por bzhi pa las 'das pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba'i khams kyis kun nas 'gengs pa ste rtsa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gengs par 'gyur bas zhes bya bar
analyzed: de ltar mes zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa nas snying rje chen por bzhi pa las 'das pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba'i khams kyis kun nas 'gengs pa ste rtsa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gengs par 'gyur bas zhes bya bar
translated: Thus, “by fire” is connected to “all the channels of the world systems are filled.”

original: 'brel to // de rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel to // de rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “All of them”

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gnas pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i skad cig ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i lam mthong pa'i lta bar gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gnas pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i skad cig ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i lam mthong pa'i lta bar gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: means that the instant the entities of the animate and inanimate world are seen, that is, the instant the path of seeing is seen, the path of seeing is the path of seeing of manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: 'di ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder.

original: de ltar mgrin pa nas snying ga'i gnas su 'od ces bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mgrin pa nas snying ga'i gnas su 'od ces bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, from the throat to the heart center, “light” means that which is seen.

original: slar yang zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dh'u'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: slar yang zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dh'u'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: Again, “moon” and so forth refers to the meaning of the syllable dhu.

original: de'i zla ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes zla ba'i gzugs chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid can byang chub kyi zla ba 'od gsal ba chos kyi dbyings snying ga'i dbus la 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya bar son pa ste /
analyzed: de'i zla ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes zla ba'i gzugs chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid can byang chub kyi zla ba 'od gsal ba chos kyi dbyings snying ga'i dbus la 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya bar son pa ste /
translated: “ Its moon” is the form of the moon of wisdom, which is the essence of all phenomena, the moon of enlightenment, the clear light, the realm of phenomena, located in the middle of the heart center, in the “world system.”

original: mgo bo'i dbus su blta bar bya ba ni ma bsgoms pa ma yin pas 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: mgo bo'i dbus su blta bar bya ba ni ma bsgoms pa ma yin pas 'ongs pa ste /
translated: “ To be seen in the middle of the head” means that it is not the case that it does not come.

original: 'phyang ba'i sgor zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chu 'gro @259b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phyang ba'i sgor zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chu 'gro @259b par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ At the door of the hanging” means that when the water moves.

original: de bzhin du snying ga'i chu'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying ga'i chu'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi zhu ba 'ong ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the wisdom nectar, which is the nature of the water of the heart center, melts and comes.

original: de ltar shes bya rnal 'byor mchog ni zhi ba la sogs pa bsrung ba chen po'i gzugs can de rnams kyis dang bsrung ba thams cad kyi gzugs kyis bsgrub bya phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes bya rnal 'byor mchog ni zhi ba la sogs pa bsrung ba chen po'i gzugs can de rnams kyis dang bsrung ba thams cad kyi gzugs kyis bsgrub bya phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi'o //
translated: Thus, the object of knowledge is the supreme yoga, which is the form of the great protection of peace, and so on. Those who have the form of all protection should view the one to be protected, who has the nature of the outer and inner,

original: 'dir phyi rol du yul phyogs gcig tsam ste /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du yul phyogs gcig tsam ste /
translated: as just one place externally.

original: nang gi bdag nyid du ni rnam par thams cad kyi gzugs dngos po gang de thams cad de'i rang bzhin ji ltar bsgom pa de'i gzugs kyis de'i gzugs can du blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid du ni rnam par thams cad kyi gzugs dngos po gang de thams cad de'i rang bzhin ji ltar bsgom pa de'i gzugs kyis de'i gzugs can du blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: But internally, whatever thing has the form of all aspects, that has the nature of that, which is the form of the meditation. One should view it as having that form. This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar slar yang gnas gang du so so re re'i sems can gyi yang blta bar bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang gnas gang du so so re re'i sems can gyi yang blta bar bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, again, in whatever place, one should view each individual sentient being, and so on.

original: mdzod sbu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mdzod sbu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “cavity of the skull,” and so on,

original: gang yang dag pa'i lta ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi don gyis te /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i lta ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi don gyis te /
translated: is the meaning of the aspect of enlightenment of the correct view.

original: des lta ba yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so ;
analyzed: des lta ba yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so ;
translated: By that, the phrase “correct view” and so on is stated.

original: / de ltar rlung gi lce gzhug bya //
analyzed: / de ltar rlung gi lce gzhug bya //
translated: In that way, the wind-tongue should be inserted.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpral pa'i gnas su rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin der gnas pa'i 'phyang ba'i rtse mor byang chub kyi zla ba thig le'i gzugs rlung chen po'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa de'i rlung gi lce de nyid thig
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpral pa'i gnas su rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin der gnas pa'i 'phyang ba'i rtse mor byang chub kyi zla ba thig le'i gzugs rlung chen po'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa de'i rlung gi lce de nyid thig
translated: This is the nature of the great wind-mandala located in the place of the forehead, in the tip of the hanging [nāḍī], the moon of enlightenment, the form of the bindu, the nature of the great wind, the support of all dharmas.

original: le gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: le gzhug par bya ste /
translated: The wind-tongue of that [bindu] should be inserted into the bindu.

original: mdzod sbu'i bu gar son pa des thams cad kyi rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdzod sbu'i bu gar son pa des thams cad kyi rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by entering the aperture of the secret place, [all] becomes the nature of that [bindu].

original: cir 'gyur na skyes bu la sogs par ro //
analyzed: cir 'gyur na skyes bu la sogs par ro //
translated: What happens? [One becomes] a person, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi yang rnam pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi yang rnam pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the meditation on the maṇḍala wheel with aspects of that nature and with aspects is stated:

original: rnal 'byor ma bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs sla'o //
translated: “The yoginīs should be meditated upon,” and so forth. It is easy to understand.

original: da ni srung ba chen po'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bri bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni srung ba chen po'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bri bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to write the wheel of the machine of the great protection, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: byang chub 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: byang chub 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: the 'awakening machine,' etc.

original: de ltar byang chub ces bya ba ni ri dags kyi lte ba'i khyad par ram 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs can la'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub ces bya ba ni ri dags kyi lte ba'i khyad par ram 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs can la'o //
translated: Thus, 'awakening' is a special deer's navel, or the form of Lokeśvara.

original: dum bu lngar zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i dum bur gcig ste de'i phyogs bzhi der de ltar bzung bas dum bu bzhi rnams de ltar dbus ma dang bcas pas lnga'o //
analyzed: dum bu lngar zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i dum bur gcig ste de'i phyogs bzhi der de ltar bzung bas dum bu bzhi rnams de ltar dbus ma dang bcas pas lnga'o //
translated: Five pieces means one piece in the center, and the four directions are taken to be that, so the four pieces, together with the center, are five.

original: @260a * // des sgrub pa po zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: @260a * // des sgrub pa po zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bri bar bya ste /
translated: By that, the practitioner is the one to be accomplished, who is to be drawn.

original: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dur khrod kyi ras la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dur khrod kyi ras la sogs pa'o //
translated: Etc. refers to charnel ground cloth, etc.

original: de ltar slar yang kun du spyod pa la sogs pa thams cad sngon bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar slar yang kun du spyod pa la sogs pa thams cad sngon bzhin du bya ste /
translated: Thus, again, all the conduct, etc. is as before.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lor go bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i bcu pa'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lor go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand the wheel of the ten of Vajravārāhī as the wheel of the ten of Vajravārāhī.

original: lhag ma rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las stobs chen ma la sogs pa'i ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor bas bsgom pa'i srung ba chen po dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang des de ltar
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las stobs chen ma la sogs pa'i ming gi yi ge'i rab tu sbyor bas bsgom pa'i srung ba chen po dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang des de ltar
translated: In the commentary on the great king of yoginī tantras, the glorious Ocean of Dakas, in the chapter called “The Ship,” the great protection of meditation by the application of the syllables of the names of Mahābalā and so on, the meditation of the maṇḍala wheel, and by that

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa phur bu'i sngags kyi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa phur bu'i sngags kyi ste /
translated: the accomplishment of the wheel of the yantra of the form of the bodhisattva, the kīla mantra,

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: and the method of meditation with oṃ gha gha ghatāya and so on, the characteristics of the ritual, are taught extensively.

original: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the forty-seventh chapter on the characteristics of the ritual.🔽Homage to Cakravarmiṇī,

original: // / las rnams thams cad rab sgrub ma'i //🔽'khor sgyur ma la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: // / las rnams thams cad rab sgrub ma'i //🔽'khor sgyur ma la phyag byas nas //
translated: who accomplishes all activities.

original: rgyas pa'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba ru //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba ru //
translated: The application of the form of increase

original: gnas kyi gtso mo bzhugs pa ste //
analyzed: gnas kyi gtso mo bzhugs pa ste //
translated: is the abode of the chief of the places.

original: lha min rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor du//
analyzed: lha min rnam pa'i 'khrul 'khor du//
translated: In the machine of the form of the demigod,

original: 'gro ba'i gtso mos sgrub pa yis //🔽mchog ster da ltar bdag gis ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso mos sgrub pa yis // mchog ster da ltar bdag gis ni /
translated: the chief of migrating beings accomplishes🔽the bestowal of the supreme.

original: de yi 'grel pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: de yi 'grel pa bshad par bya //
translated: Now I will explain its commentary.

original: da ni rgyas pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs can ma 'khor los sgyur ma rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rgyas pa'i rnam pa'i gzugs can ma 'khor los sgyur ma rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of the forty-eighth chapter, which is the chapter of Cakravit, the form of the increase of Vairocanī, is stated.

original: de nas las kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas las kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, “all actions” and so on.🔽The supreme is the chief, because there is nothing higher than all actions.

original: mchog ni gtso bo ste las thams cad kyi gong na med pa nyid kyi phyir te de rnams tshig thams cad du 'byung ba 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: mchog ni gtso bo ste las thams cad kyi gong na med pa nyid kyi phyir te de rnams tshig thams cad du 'byung ba 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyi bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Those that are explained in all the words that occur should be explained.

original: de rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Those are stated.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Cakravit and so on.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams gsungs so //
translated: The half-verse teaches the words of the brief explanation.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation is stated:

original: gtum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gtum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Caṇḍālī” and so forth.

original: 'dir thog mar rtsa'i yi ge la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ma'i @260b ming gi yi ge lhag par brjod de /🔽des gtum mo spar ba lte bar zhes bya ba ste sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas bsreg pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir thog mar rtsa'i yi ge la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ma'i @260b ming gi yi ge lhag par brjod de / des gtum mo spar ba lte bar zhes bya ba ste sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas bsreg pa ste /
translated: Here, first, the syllables of the channels and so on are stated in excess of the syllables of the name of Cakrasaṃvara.

original: rang bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: “Caṇḍālī blazes at the navel” and so on: by the reasoning explained previously, it burns, that is, it is made natural.

original: tshig thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad ni dbang po rnams 'gro ba'i dus su gang rnam par rtog pa skyes te de rnams su sreg pa nyid pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par de'i rang bzhin du skye ba yang bsreg go //
analyzed: tshig thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad ni dbang po rnams 'gro ba'i dus su gang rnam par rtog pa skyes te de rnams su sreg pa nyid pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par de'i rang bzhin du skye ba yang bsreg go //
translated: “All words” and so on: all is the arising of the conceptual thoughts of the sense organs at the time of going. Since they are burned there, the nature of all tathāgatas arises there as well and is burned.

original: de ltar tshig kyang bsreg pa ste lte ba'i 'khor lo skyes pa bsreg go //
analyzed: de ltar tshig kyang bsreg pa ste lte ba'i 'khor lo skyes pa bsreg go //
translated: Thus, the words are burned, that is, the arising of the navel cakra is burned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par bsregs pas snying ga 'khor lor skyes pa rnams kyis der 'ongs nas bsreg go ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par bsregs pas snying ga 'khor lor skyes pa rnams kyis der 'ongs nas bsreg go ;
translated: Having come there, they are burned.

original: / de bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lor son pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bsreg go //
analyzed: / de bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lor son pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bsreg go //
translated: Likewise, those called “eye, etc.” are burned, i.e., Locana, etc., who reside in the throat wheel, and who are of the nature of the earth mandala, etc.

original: de rnams bsregs nas slar yang thig le'i gnas su song nas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bsreg go ;
analyzed: de rnams bsregs nas slar yang thig le'i gnas su song nas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bsreg go ;
translated: Having burned those, they again go to the place of the drop and burn Rupavajrā, etc.

original: / dbang po rnams rang bzhin med par mthong bas dus thams cad du de'i bdag nyid can du gnas so //
analyzed: / dbang po rnams rang bzhin med par mthong bas dus thams cad du de'i bdag nyid can du gnas so //
translated: By seeing the sense organs as essenceless, one always abides in the nature of that.

original: de ltar sreg pa rnams su yang 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid pas skad cig thams cad du de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang spro pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sreg pa rnams su yang 'dod chags chen po'i tshul nyid pas skad cig thams cad du de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang spro pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the cremations are also the method of great passion, the yogins and yoginis will always experience joy and delight.

original: de'i byang chub kyi zla ba bskyed pa ste rkan gyi dbus su 'phyang ba'i gtso mor phyin nas 'dir gzhom du med pa'i thig le'u gzigs kyis rdo rje sems dpar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i byang chub kyi zla ba bskyed pa ste rkan gyi dbus su 'phyang ba'i gtso mor phyin nas 'dir gzhom du med pa'i thig le'u gzigs kyis rdo rje sems dpar gnas so //
translated: Having generated the moon of enlightenment, that is, having gone to the principal one hanging in the middle of the palate, here Vajrasattva abides with the vision of the indestructible drop.

original: de ltar 'dzag pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'dzag pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzag pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'dzag pa ste /
translated: Thus, “dripping” is the dripping of Vajrasattva.

original: de yang kra'i yi ges bshad pa 'gro //
analyzed: de yang kra'i yi ges bshad pa 'gro //
translated: That is also explained by the syllable kṣa.🔽“🔽Going” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.🔽🔽

original: de sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'dzag pa'i rgyun bgrod pas na kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'dzag pa'i rgyun bgrod pas na kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: That of all sentient beings” is the universal going because of the path of the stream of dripping.

original: lus thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i mtshams rnams su pa thag gi skud pa'i dra ba dang dra ba'i byang chub kyi zla ba'i 'od zer 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: lus thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i mtshams rnams su pa thag gi skud pa'i dra ba dang dra ba'i byang chub kyi zla ba'i 'od zer 'gro ba ste /
translated: The light rays of the moon of enlightenment of the net of threads of the body at all the various junctures go.

original: de rnams kyi 'od zer gyis 'bigs shing 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'od zer gyis 'bigs shing 'gro bar byed de /
translated: Those light rays pierce and cause going.

original: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis bgrod pa'o //
translated: They go by way of the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: myang ba zhes bya ba ni rtsa so so rnams su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: myang ba zhes bya ba ni rtsa so so rnams su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba myong bar byed do //
translated: “Tasting” means experiencing the innate joy in each of the channels.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And so it is said:

original: rkan du rdo rje 'dud @261a * //
analyzed: rkan du rdo rje 'dud @261a * //
translated: The vajra bow is drawn in the palate,

original: rtsis zhus // rtsa thams cad du gtong bar byed //
analyzed: rtsis zhus // rtsa thams cad du gtong bar byed //
translated: and the arrow is released into all the channels.

original: rnam par shes pas rtag myang bar //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rtag myang bar //
translated: Consciousness always tastes,

original: thams cad spyod pas shes par byed //
analyzed: thams cad spyod pas shes par byed //
translated: and it is known by the practice of all.

original: re re'i de che spyod pa yis //
analyzed: re re'i de che spyod pa yis //
translated: By the practice of each of those,

original: rtsa kun du ni myang bar ni //
analyzed: rtsa kun du ni myang bar ni //
translated: all the channels are tasted.

original: skud pa'i dra ba rnams kyis byed //
analyzed: skud pa'i dra ba rnams kyis byed //
translated: It is done by the network of threads,

original: mtshams kun du ni 'khyam pas so //
analyzed: mtshams kun du ni 'khyam pas so //
translated: wandering in all the directions.

original: zhes so // de ltar byas pas yang gnas skabs bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar byas pas yang gnas skabs bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, by doing that, the four states are also described:

original: 'thom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'thom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Dizzy” and so forth.

original: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis kyang ste 'thom zhes bya ba ni bde ba la ngal so ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i yi ge'i don gyis kyang ste 'thom zhes bya ba ni bde ba la ngal so ba'o //
translated: It is also by the meaning of the syllable va: “Dizzy” means resting in bliss.

original: rmugs zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems son pas par rnams su gnas so ;
analyzed: rmugs zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems son pas par rnams su gnas so ;
translated: “Drowsy” means abiding in the channels by the descent of bodhicitta.

original: / ye shes zhes bya ba ni yi shes tsam mo //
analyzed: / ye shes zhes bya ba ni yi shes tsam mo //
translated: “Knowledge” means mere consciousness.

original: de yang 'gro ba med ces bya ba ni mi snang bar song ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba med ces bya ba ni mi snang bar song ba'o //
translated: And there is no going means that it does not appear.

original: der yang 'ong zhes bya ba ni bsam du med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der yang 'ong zhes bya ba ni bsam du med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And there is coming there means that it is the meaning of inconceivable wisdom.

original: bshad pa'i rim pa 'dis phyag rgya //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rim pa 'dis phyag rgya //
translated: By this process of explanation, the seal

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i'o //
translated: means the great seal.

original: lo'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni lo gcig tu goms pas rnal 'byor pa de sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: lo'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni lo gcig tu goms pas rnal 'byor pa de sgrub pa ste /
translated: By the application of the year, means that by being accustomed to it for one year, that yogin accomplishes it.

original: phyag rgya chen po 'thob ba la 'dir the tshom med do //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'thob ba la 'dir the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt here about the attainment of the great seal.

original: de ltar de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ta'i yi ge'i don gyis te de de bzhin du bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: de ltar de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ta'i yi ge'i don gyis te de de bzhin du bshad pa byed do //
translated: Thus, that and so forth, by the meaning of the letter ta, means that it is explained in that way.

original: dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su sbyor ba'i ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
analyzed: dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su sbyor ba'i ra'i yi ge'i don gyis so //
translated: By joy and so forth, by the meaning of the letter ra of the compound,

original: gtong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: gtong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: giving and so forth, by the meaning of the letter ni,

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad gtong //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad gtong //
translated: means that all conceptualization is given up.

original: zhes bya ba ni grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang du rnal 'byor pas rnam par shes pa'i ye shes gtong ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang du rnal 'byor pas rnam par shes pa'i ye shes gtong ste /
translated: Thus, within countless world systems, the yogi/nī emits the gnosis of consciousness.
