original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa de gom pa gcig kyang mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dngos pos gom pa gcig sa la mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa de gom pa gcig kyang mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dngos pos gom pa gcig sa la mi 'gro'o //
translated: However, that yogi/nī does not even take a single step, that is, with the entity of the body, does not take a single step on the ground.

original: de'i phyir mtshams thams cad kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim par gyur pa 'dis kyang rnam pa gcig tu gtong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams thams cad kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim par gyur pa 'dis kyang rnam pa gcig tu gtong ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of all the boundaries, that is, by this process explained previously, is not emitted in one way.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam du'o //
translated: All world systems are mere imagination.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽bdag gi gdan la de lta'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / bdag gi gdan la de lta'o //
translated: That itself is stated:🔽“On my seat, it is like that.”

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi rang bzhin thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi rang bzhin thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: all things, the nature of all things, the nature of the realm of phenomena, is seen.

original: 'di'i sbyor @261b bas yang ma ru'i yi ge gnyis kyi nges pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor @261b bas yang ma ru'i yi ge gnyis kyi nges pa'i tshul gyis gsungs pa /
translated: The application of this is also stated by the method of the two syllables ma ra🔽na.

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Death and so on.

original: ma'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: ma'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
translated: By the meaning of the syllable ma.

original: 'chi bas mi 'bigs 'di'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rnal 'byor gyis te /
analyzed: 'chi bas mi 'bigs 'di'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rnal 'byor gyis te /
translated: Because of death not piercing this, it is this yoga.

original: gzhan gyi gdan du yongs su gnas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdan du yongs su gnas //
translated: It is fully present in the seat of another.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdan bzhi pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa'i gzhan gyi dbugs rgyu ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'chi ba slu ba ste bshad pa'i sbyor bas kyang 'chi bas mi 'bigs te ra'i yi ge'i yang don du song ba ste ma ra na'i sgras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdan bzhi pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa'i gzhan gyi dbugs rgyu ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'chi ba slu ba ste bshad pa'i sbyor bas kyang 'chi bas mi 'bigs te ra'i yi ge'i yang don du song ba ste ma ra na'i sgras so //
translated: The meaning of the syllable ra is that by the application of the explanation of deceiving death, which is the nature of the breath of another and so on, as stated in the Catuḥpīṭha Tantra, death does not pierce this.

original: de phyir gang gang las rnams la bltas nas //
analyzed: de phyir gang gang las rnams la bltas nas //
translated: Therefore, having seen whatever karma,

original: zhes bya ba ste khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi len pa la sogs pa'i las sam zhi ba la sogs pa skad cig gcig la de'i bdag nyid kyis der 'jug pa ste der thams cad nas thams cad du dus thams cad du byed do ni mdzad
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi len pa la sogs pa'i las sam zhi ba la sogs pa skad cig gcig la de'i bdag nyid kyis der 'jug pa ste der thams cad nas thams cad du dus thams cad du byed do ni mdzad
translated: Thus, he acts in all ways, everywhere, and at all times, with the nature of all the karma of beings of the three realms, such as taking up, in a single moment, and so on.

original: pa'o // de ltar gal te de srid de nyid kyi dus la brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi len pa la sogs pa'i las blta zhing de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pas des de ltar thams cad mthong bas las kyi zhi ba la sogs
analyzed: pa'o // de ltar gal te de srid de nyid kyi dus la brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi len pa la sogs pa'i las blta zhing de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pas des de ltar thams cad mthong bas las kyi zhi ba la sogs
translated: Thus, if that is possible, then at that time, all the karma of taking up, and so on, of the stable and moving, and so on, should be seen, and by realizing reality, all should be seen in that way.

original: pas las gcig sgrub pa'i dus su yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: pas las gcig sgrub pa'i dus su yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not asserted that at the time of accomplishing one karma, such as pacifying, all are accomplished.

original: de re re las re re'i de ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de re re las re re'i de ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: If it is asked how each one is desired from each one,

original: thams cad mthong bas zhes bya ba'i the tshom gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mthong bas zhes bya ba'i the tshom gyis gsungs pa /
translated: it is said with “all are seen.”

original: 'char ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tu'i yi ge'i yongs su sbyor ba'i au'i yi ge don gyis te /
analyzed: 'char ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tu'i yi ge'i yongs su sbyor ba'i au'i yi ge don gyis te /
translated: “ Arising” and so on. The letter tu is the combination of the letter u.

original: 'char ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni dbugs gcig gi nang du rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi khams du ma bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'char ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni dbugs gcig gi nang du rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi khams du ma bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called “time of arising” is that within a single breath the yogī generates many realms of sentient beings.

original: de ltar bas na de'i dus kyis re re'i sems can gyi re re'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las su shes par bya ste de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi gdan yang dag pa'i lam du 'dod pa ste 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bas na de'i dus kyis re re'i sems can gyi re re'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las su shes par bya ste de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi gdan yang dag pa'i lam du 'dod pa ste 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Since that is so, one should understand that the karma of each and every sentient being is pacified and so on by that time. Therefore, the seat of yoga is the path of reality, which is asserted to be the means of attainment.

original: gdan gsum po 'di rnams lhag par rtogs pas mchog ste gtso bo de'i bdag nyid du khyab pa po gsang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gdan gsum po 'di rnams lhag par rtogs pas mchog ste gtso bo de'i bdag nyid du khyab pa po gsang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who realizes these three seats is supreme, that is, the principal one. The pervader of that nature is called “secret.”🔽The seat of the secret is the one who abides in the end of the secret.

original: gsang ba'i mthar gnas pa gsang pa'i gdan te his ni gang gi phyir te thams cad mkhyen pa gdan gsum gyi nye bar spyod pa las thams cad kyi gzugs @262a * //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mthar gnas pa gsang pa'i gdan te his ni gang gi phyir te thams cad mkhyen pa gdan gsum gyi nye bar spyod pa las thams cad kyi gzugs @262a * //
translated: The one who is so, that is, the omniscient one, is the form of all from the enjoyment of the three seats.

original: thams cad de thams cad mkhyen pa gsang ba'i gdan de'i bad gnyid can te /
analyzed: thams cad de thams cad mkhyen pa gsang ba'i gdan de'i bad gnyid can te /
translated: The one who is all, that is, the omniscient one, is the sleep of that secret seat.

original: gang yang rnal 'byor pas de de dang 'dra ba las thams cad pa sems can rnams la bstan pas thams cad mkhyen pa skye ba 'di nyid la ste bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o /
analyzed: gang yang rnal 'byor pas de de dang 'dra ba las thams cad pa sems can rnams la bstan pas thams cad mkhyen pa skye ba 'di nyid la ste bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o /
translated: Also, the yogi/nī, having shown that to all sentient beings, who are like that, will generate omniscience in this very lifetime. This is the definite statement of the Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /🔽sgrub pa'i lam la brten pa yis //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa / sgrub pa'i lam la brten pa yis //
translated: Similarly, it is also said:🔽The wisdom that is imagined

original: ye shes kun du brtags pa las //
analyzed: ye shes kun du brtags pa las //
translated: From the path of practice🔽Is seen by the one who has the perception of self

original: gnas dang dus tshigs rim nyid kyis //
analyzed: gnas dang dus tshigs rim nyid kyis //
translated: Through the stages of place, season, and time.

original: mthong bas bdag nyid 'du shes can //🔽gzhan gyi khyab byed bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: mthong bas bdag nyid 'du shes can // gzhan gyi khyab byed bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The one who has the perception of self

original: las ni bltas pa yis ni gyis /
analyzed: las ni bltas pa yis ni gyis /
translated: Should perform the action of looking.

original: gnyi ga yi yang rnal 'byor che //
analyzed: gnyi ga yi yang rnal 'byor che //
translated: The great yoga of both

original: rnal 'byor gyi ni ming gis brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi ni ming gis brjod //
translated: Is expressed by the name “yoga.”

original: gsang ba kun bdag nyid dben ba //
analyzed: gsang ba kun bdag nyid dben ba //
translated: The nature of the lord of all secrets

original: kun rdzob myang 'das bdag nyid can //
analyzed: kun rdzob myang 'das bdag nyid can //
translated: Has the nature of the relative nirvāṇa.🔽The nature of the realization of reality

original: yang dag rtogs pa'i rang bzhin bdag / byang chub chen po sgrub par byed //
analyzed: yang dag rtogs pa'i rang bzhin bdag / byang chub chen po sgrub par byed //
translated: Is the one who accomplishes great awakening.

original: ces so // 'di'i don gyis kyang yang dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste le'u 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag pa'i rtogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs su gsungs so //
analyzed: ces so // 'di'i don gyis kyang yang dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste le'u 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag pa'i rtogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs su gsungs so //
translated: This is the meaning of correct and so forth, and in this chapter the Blessed One has taught the factors of enlightenment as correct understanding.

original: da ni rgyas pa'i las kyi rgyud las thams cad pa'i thabs sam rgyas pa'i rgyud de rnams sgrub pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas dang cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rgyas pa'i las kyi rgyud las thams cad pa'i thabs sam rgyas pa'i rgyud de rnams sgrub pa'i sbyin sreg gi rdzas dang cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in the Tantra of the Ritual Action of Increase, the substances and ritual of the burnt offering for the accomplishment of the means or the increase tantras of all the families are taught.

original: lang rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang bzhin dngos grub ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi nye bar spyod pas so //
analyzed: lang rta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang bzhin dngos grub ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi nye bar spyod pas so //
translated: The nature siddhi is the siddhi of the great seal, by means of the enjoyments of the outer and inner natures.

original: rang gi sbyor ba'i rkyen gyis skyes //
analyzed: rang gi sbyor ba'i rkyen gyis skyes //
translated: It is born from the condition of one's own application.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag gi rnal 'byor las byung ba gang gi tshe yi dags la sogs pa thams cad rang gi yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag gi rnal 'byor las byung ba gang gi tshe yi dags la sogs pa thams cad rang gi yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis so //
translated: It is born from the condition of one's own yoga. When all the pretas and so forth are merely imagined by one's own mind,

original: 'di de'i 'khrul 'khor thams cad ces bya ba ni sgrol ma'i dum bu dgu'i bdag nyid can la'o //
analyzed: 'di de'i 'khrul 'khor thams cad ces bya ba ni sgrol ma'i dum bu dgu'i bdag nyid can la'o //
translated: This is all the yantras of that which has the nature of the nine parts of Tara.

original: skul byed ma'i lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: skul byed ma'i lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The five of Cunda.

original: 'od zer can gyi dum bu bdun gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'od zer can gyi dum bu bdun gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The seven of Marici.

original: khro gnyer ma'i drug go /
analyzed: khro gnyer ma'i drug go /
translated: The six of Bhrikuti.

original: ri khrod lo ma can gyi dum bu bdun gyi bdag nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: ri khrod lo ma can gyi dum bu bdun gyi bdag nyid du bya'o //
translated: The seven of Jatajata should be made.

original: sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni aom t'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni aom t'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mantra syllables are Om Tare etc.

original: yang na dum bu gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu'i bdag nyid can la'o //
analyzed: yang na dum bu gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu'i bdag nyid can la'o //
translated: Or, it is the nature of the fifty less one part.

original: 'di rnams kun lha'i 'khrul 'khor bzhin zhes bya ba ni @262b bsgrub bya sngags kyi bar la sogs par nang du bcug nas phyi rol du yang de nyid kyis de ltar bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kun lha'i 'khrul 'khor bzhin zhes bya ba ni @262b bsgrub bya sngags kyi bar la sogs par nang du bcug nas phyi rol du yang de nyid kyis de ltar bskor bar bya'o //
translated: All of these are like the divine yantras, which means that having placed the mantra etc. of the object of attainment inside, one should also rotate it externally in the same way.

original: bskyed pa dang ni gnas pa'i rgyur //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang ni gnas pa'i rgyur //
translated: For the cause of generation and abiding,

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dbus su rang rang gi sgrub thabs su bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rigs pas rang gi dkyil 'khor du gnas pas gnas pa thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dbus su rang rang gi sgrub thabs su bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rigs pas rang gi dkyil 'khor du gnas pas gnas pa thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the middle of the Tārā and so forth tantras, one should accomplish all the abodes by the reasoning of the creation stage explained in one’s own sādhana, abiding in one’s own maṇḍala.

original: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.🔽Now, he explains the meditation of the maṇḍala wheel of Cakravarmiṇī:

original: da ni 'khor los sgyur ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa/'khor los sgyur ma'i lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: da ni 'khor los sgyur ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa gsungs pa/'khor los sgyur ma'i lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtogs sla'o //
translated: The goddess Cakravarmiṇī, and so forth.

original: da ni lha ma yin gyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lha ma yin gyi 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he explains the machine of the demigods:

original: lha ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The demigod, and so forth.

original: de ltar lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni phag gam lha ma yin gyi rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni phag gam lha ma yin gyi rnam pa la'o //
translated: Thus, the demigod is either a pig or the form of a demigod.🔽With the essence of the sow,

original: phag mo'i snying po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye'am /🔽sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye'am /
analyzed: phag mo'i snying po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye'am / sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye'am /
translated: either Oṃ vajra-varṇīye,🔽or sarva-buddha-ḍākinīye,

original: badzra barnna n'i ye'ang rung ngo //
analyzed: badzra barnna n'i ye'ang rung ngo //
translated: or vajra-varṇanīye.

original: lhag ma legs par go'o //
analyzed: lhag ma legs par go'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the wheel of Yama's enemy is stated.

original: gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The so-called wheel of Yama's enemy and so forth.

original: dum bu bcu bdun can zhes bya ba ni dbus su lnga de'i phyi rol du bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dum bu bcu bdun can zhes bya ba ni dbus su lnga de'i phyi rol du bcu gnyis so //
translated: The so-called having seventeen sections is five in the center, and twelve outside of that.

original: de'i phyi rol du ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dum bu bcu drug rnams kyi dum bu re re bar dum bu brgyad brgyad rnams la yi ge re re ste hr'i:ma gsungs kyang bi kri t'a na na bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dum bu bcu drug rnams kyi dum bu re re bar dum bu brgyad brgyad rnams la yi ge re re ste hr'i:ma gsungs kyang bi kri t'a na na bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside of that, as before means that in each of the sixteen sections of those, in each of the eight sections, there is one letter. Although hrīḥ is not stated, vikṛtānana is written.

original: lhag ma rnams su hr'i: shtr'i:la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya'i ming nang du bcug pa ste de bzhin dum bu bcu bdun rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams su hr'i: shtr'i:la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya'i ming nang du bcug pa ste de bzhin dum bu bcu bdun rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
translated: In the rest, hrīḥ, śatrūṇāṃ, and so forth, the name of the victim is inserted inside. Thus, the letters of the mantra of the seventeen sections are stated.

original: yam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The so-called yaṃ, and so forth.

original: dbus kyi dum bu lnga'i lte bar yi ge ya /
analyzed: dbus kyi dum bu lnga'i lte bar yi ge ya /
translated: In the center of the five sections, the letter ya.

original: g-yas su ma /
analyzed: g-yas su ma /
translated: To the right, ma.

original: nub tu me /🔽byang du pa /
analyzed: nub tu me / byang du pa /
translated: In the west, me.🔽In the north, pa.

original: shar du kshe zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shar du kshe zhes bya'o //
translated: In the east, kṣe.

original: de'i phyi rol du r'a dz'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa lho nas brtsams nas dum bu bcu gnyis rnams su yi ge bcu gnyis rnams ji lta ba'i rim pas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du r'a dz'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa lho nas brtsams nas dum bu bcu gnyis rnams su yi ge bcu gnyis rnams ji lta ba'i rim pas bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside of that, one should write the twelve syllables in the twelve sectors, beginning from the south, with the syllable rā and so on, in the order of the syllables.

original: de ltar byas pas las bcu bdun rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas las bcu bdun rnams te /
translated: By doing so, there are seventeen actions:

original: sdang ba dang rmongs pa dang phrag dog dang 'dod chags dang ser sna dang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang bsad pa dang bskrad pa @263a * //
analyzed: sdang ba dang rmongs pa dang phrag dog dang 'dod chags dang ser sna dang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang bsad pa dang bskrad pa @263a * //
translated: hatred, delusion, envy, passion, avarice, pacification, prosperity, power, summoning, killing,🔽banishing,

original: dang bcing ba dang mngon spyod do //
analyzed: dang bcing ba dang mngon spyod do //
translated: binding, and assault.

original: sdang ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gshin rje lnga'o //
analyzed: sdang ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gshin rje lnga'o //
translated: Hatred and so on are the five heroes of Yamarī.

original: de bzhin du mtshams na gnas ba mo'i rnal 'byor ma gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshams na gnas ba mo'i rnal 'byor ma gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the yoginīs residing in the intermediate directions are Mohapriyā and so on.

original: de bzhin du dbyug pa dang tho ba dang padma dang ral gri'i 'phags pa gshin rje sgo skyong rnams kyis las bcu gsum rnams go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyug pa dang tho ba dang padma dang ral gri'i 'phags pa gshin rje sgo skyong rnams kyis las bcu gsum rnams go bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand the thirteen actions of Daṇḍa, Musala, Padma, and Khaḍga, the heroes guarding the gates of Yamarī.

original: slar yang thong ba bzhi rnams kyis las bzhi rnams te rim pa ji lta bas chu la 'chag pa dang me'i dbus su 'jug pa dang sa la 'dzul pa dang rlung gi dngos po thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa ste gshin rje'i dgra'i rgyud chen po'i go
analyzed: slar yang thong ba bzhi rnams kyis las bzhi rnams te rim pa ji lta bas chu la 'chag pa dang me'i dbus su 'jug pa dang sa la 'dzul pa dang rlung gi dngos po thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa ste gshin rje'i dgra'i rgyud chen po'i go
translated: Again, the four actions are the four activities, respectively, of walking on water, entering into the middle of fire, penetrating the earth, and engaging in all things of the wind, according to the sequence.

original: bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definite statement.

original: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The rest is just as it is.

original: da ni rdza rnga'i sngags btub gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdza rnga'i sngags btub gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the mantra of the clay drum is stated:

original: gzhan yang rdza rnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdza rnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Also, clay drum and so forth.

original: khyab bdag rang gis zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: khyab bdag rang gis zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The all-pervading lord himself is in the form of the mantra syllables.

original: lhag ma ji ltar nges brjod bla mar gsungs pa'i rigs pas bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
analyzed: lhag ma ji ltar nges brjod bla mar gsungs pa'i rigs pas bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
translated: The rest is to be done by the reasoning taught in the Udanavarga. This is the instruction.

original: des mtshams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mdud pa thams cad de spyi gtsug la sogs pa nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar rnams su rtsa so so'i kha'i bu ga ni mtshams su go bar bya ste /🔽de ltar yi ges rtsa rnams la //
analyzed: des mtshams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mdud pa thams cad de spyi gtsug la sogs pa nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar rnams su rtsa so so'i kha'i bu ga ni mtshams su go bar bya ste / de ltar yi ges rtsa rnams la //
translated: The phrase in all the junctures means in all the knots of the body, from the crown of the head down to the toes, and so forth. The juncture should be understood as the opening of the mouth of each channel.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rnam pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rnam pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Thus, the channels by the syllables means by the forms of the syllables.

original: tshigs bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po de rnams kyi so sor re re'i yang mtshams kyi grangs gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshigs bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po de rnams kyi so sor re re'i yang mtshams kyi grangs gsungs pa /
translated: The number of junctures of each of those forty-nine channels is stated:

original: mkha' dus me zhes bya ba ste drug cu lhag pa'i brgya gsum gyi tshigs te lo'i tshes grangs so //
analyzed: mkha' dus me zhes bya ba ste drug cu lhag pa'i brgya gsum gyi tshigs te lo'i tshes grangs so //
translated: Space, time, fire, and so forth, that is, sixty-one hundred junctures, which are the number of days in a year.

original: lhag ma thams cad legs par go'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad legs par go'o //
translated: The rest is all well understood.

original: de ltar thams cad kyang rdo rje phag mo'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo bcu gcig par gsungs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su yang bya'o zhes 'di ni des pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyang rdo rje phag mo'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags dang 'khor lo bcu gcig par gsungs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su yang bya'o zhes 'di ni des pa'o //
translated: Thus, all of this should be done in the yogas of Vajravarahi's wheel and mantra, which are taught in the eleven-faced wheel. This is the definitive explanation.

original: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las 'khor los sgyur ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba rnams su bsgom pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa las sna tshogs pa'i sgrub pa rnams
analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las 'khor los sgyur ma'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba rnams su bsgom pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa las sna tshogs pa'i sgrub pa rnams
translated: The Ship, a commentary on the glorious Ocean of Dakas, the great king of tantras, explains the various types of sādhanas, such as meditation and fire-offering rituals, that are performed with the applications of the syllables of Cakravartinī and so forth.

original: dang / dpal sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang de bzhin du @263b 'khor los sgyur ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / de'i 'khrul 'khor phag mo'i snying po'i 'khrul 'khor dang / gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags kyis kyang sna tshogs pa'i las kyis rang bzhin bsgrub pa dang rdza rnga ma'i sngags btu ba'i sbyor ba ste las kyi tshogs thams cad kyi cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang / dpal sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang de bzhin du @263b 'khor los sgyur ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / de'i 'khrul 'khor phag mo'i snying po'i 'khrul 'khor dang / gshin rje'i dgra'i 'khrul 'khor dang sngags kyis kyang sna tshogs pa'i las kyis rang bzhin bsgrub pa dang rdza rnga ma'i sngags btu ba'i sbyor ba ste las kyi tshogs thams cad kyi cho ga'i mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: It also explains the meditation on the wheel of Cakravartinī and so forth, the maṇḍala wheels of Cakravartinī and so forth, the yantras of the glorious Tārā and so forth, the yantra of the essence of Vārāhī, the yantra of Yama, the various types of activities that are accomplished with mantras, and the application of the extraction of the mantra of Ghaṇṭāpāda.

original: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Chapter Forty-Eight

original: // / gsang ba'i man ngag ston pa mo //
analyzed: // / gsang ba'i man ngag ston pa mo //
translated: The Explanation of the Secret Instruction

original: thog mar brtson chen mar btud nas //
analyzed: thog mar brtson chen mar btud nas //
translated: First, having bowed to the one of great diligence,

original: 'khor los sgyur rgyal la sogs dang // rgyas pa yang ni sgrub pa mo //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur rgyal la sogs dang // rgyas pa yang ni sgrub pa mo //
translated: The one who accomplishes the universal monarch and so on,

original: phan pa'i don du las thams cad //
analyzed: phan pa'i don du las thams cad //
translated: The one who accomplishes all activities for the benefit of others,

original: bcud len la sogs gsang ba mo'i //🔽rgyas bshad tshig tu bshad pa mo //
analyzed: bcud len la sogs gsang ba mo'i // rgyas bshad tshig tu bshad pa mo //
translated: The one who is secret, such as the elixir and so on,🔽The one who is explained in the extensive explanation,

original: de yi 'grel pa rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de yi 'grel pa rab bshad bya //
translated: The one who is explained in the commentary will be explained.

original: da ni brtson 'grus chen po sgrub pa'i thabs kyi phyir le'u bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni brtson 'grus chen po sgrub pa'i thabs kyi phyir le'u bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain chapter forty-nine, the method of accomplishing great diligence, it is said:

original: de nas yang ni gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang ni gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, another and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni nyung ngu bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni nyung ngu bsdus pa ste /
translated: In brief means concisely.

original: rgyas pa'i las la sogs pa gang gis sems can thams cad la phan pa 'byung ba ste 'khor los sgyur ma la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i las la sogs pa gang gis sems can thams cad la phan pa 'byung ba ste 'khor los sgyur ma la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The extensive rites and so forth, by which the welfare of all sentient beings arises, that is, by which one accomplishes the Cakravartin and so forth, those will be explained.

original: de ltar gtso bo zhes bya ba ni mchog ste /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo zhes bya ba ni mchog ste /
translated: Thus, the principal one is the best,

original: mu ste gas can la sogs pa la med pa'o //
analyzed: mu ste gas can la sogs pa la med pa'o //
translated: not existing for the Mīmāṃsaka and so forth.

original: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba de gsungs pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba de gsungs pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He states that by which one accomplishes, the great one and so forth.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: One verse concisely teaches the words.

original: de ltar 'khrul 'khor mi'i gzugs can zhes bya ba ni spre'u'i rnam pa 'chad par 'gyur bas nye bar ston to //
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul 'khor mi'i gzugs can zhes bya ba ni spre'u'i rnam pa 'chad par 'gyur bas nye bar ston to //
translated: Thus, the machine in the form of a man is taught by the description of the monkey form that will occur.

original: da ni thog ma nyid du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sems kyi lhag par mos pas las kyi dus su yang byang chub sgrub pa la lus kyi khams yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni thog ma nyid du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sems kyi lhag par mos pas las kyi dus su yang byang chub sgrub pa la lus kyi khams yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, at the very beginning, the yogis, by the superior faith in the mind, also accomplish awakening at the time of the rite, and the elements of the body are stated to be the nature of the qualities.

original: 'phyang ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: 'phyang ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: The hanging and so forth.
